NvPl0s6Zp1ID8osFL_0jGQ.text: I don't see a single "negative" review.  zPizza is the best gluten-free option in the Phoenix metro area!! It's a small family owned business in the heart of Central Phoenix. If you don't live close, come anyway. The food and service is worth the drive! While you're there, try a dessert at the Pink Spot next door. Yummy!

-waH_8h_WXnN53pmrcc_tg.text: I always like to stop in here and get artichokes pizza, they have really good toppings here to choose from.

rKth_oJQ-CPZVnWhwXxPHg.text: I went to Z PIzza out of convenience. It is within walking distance from the ER and the person who was in the ER was irrationally hungry. At 6:30 on Sunday night I walked to Z Pizza to get 4 slices of pizza because it was faster than ordering a full pizza. The slices were awful. They were old. They cost $13. They were only barely warmed in the pizza oven.   If you don't see the pizzas come out of the oven then don't expect them to be good. Lesson learned.

XmNEP99Xza6G5uKOU-FmNw.text: Last week, my friend and I went to Z Pizza and had some great thin crust pizzas. She called in the order and asked about the crust being gluten free, which it is. (That was only for a FYI purpose, not because we wanted gluten free). When she placed the order the person let her know that something we got as a topping was not gluten free, which was totally OK with us. She got a call back later from another person letting her know the same info. That is a good customer service touch and we both wanted to give Z Pizza a shout out for taking care of their customers. Plus...their pizzas are really yummy!

jXYl45wS8-v6uq_D50jJhg.text: I really wanted to like this place. Sadly, our pizza was cold and underdone. It didn't improve, even after being put in our oven. We ended up throwing it out. Two stars for their use of organic and local ingredients.

dLdiKOUyLi42y1NRNQu9Kg.text: I love this place. When I go to Phoenix for work I always stop in for a late night dinner. Open late and the quality is high all the way until closing time. Great selection of drinks to go.

ihorIAYWq3JR-AH-m8gr8A.text: Good pizza ... they deliver to downtown ... cute restaurant with TVs and the local paper for your enjoyment ... two slices and soda for something like $4.99 ... nice addition to downtown!

lbBojuRSIenTM68gz7o5uQ.text: We ordered 4 rusticas for delivery using their buy-one-get-one promo online. They had a great deal on rustica pizzas, but somewhere in the fine print (after our delivery) we realize that the 2-for-1 offer was limited to 1 order only. This caused lots of waiting time as the delivery boy cleared it up. They honoured the 2-for-1 so we were happy. Pretty good pizza. I like the crust. The curry chicken yam rustica and the Mediterranean were my favourites. Nothing super amazing but definitely better than your run-of-the-mill pizza joint. A great price if you get a promo deal.

8rYwy5TGsGHYvVMl5hfiKw.text: After my so-so experience a few months ago I had the chance to try zpizza again today with a group of friends. The Napoli pizza I ordered was absolutely incredible and I would have eaten the whole thing by myself (large) had I been able to! I will coming back every time that I'm in town to get some amazing pizza.

1WYYDHX1p_OZzKY1AdNmIg.text: I have always loved Zpizza. I haven't had it in awhile since the location near me closed and then I became a Vegan and pretty much swore off Pizza.   I heard that they now have a VEGAN pizza and are serving it by the slice this weekend! (5/14-5/16) I went in for a slice and left with 4! It was pretty damn Delicious!  I cant wait to go back and order up my own Vegan creation, Like the ZBQ No chicken, sub vegan cheese, I might just die!   All hail Zpizza for making pizza possible for Vegans!

2tq3BZJMmOA5VYo7gUSSgw.text: Zpizza is so good! I order on-line because I work downtown in an office and don't get to leave my desk often. They have a 10.00 minimum charge which I think is pretty normal and standard. Their pizza is so delicious! Crust is soft and flavorful and they put lots of cheese and ingredients! If you order on-line you can make special comments or tell them exactly how you want your order and they make it accordingly. Very good! Love this place!

HT4455DmPtyHSm7KasLz8A.text: Gluten-free, vegan pizza. Friendly, helpful staff. Exciting topping options like shiitake mushrooms and zucchini. Awesome. The crust was a little overcooked.

ujFgmFqfXXtIpARWUQaJzw.text: Burn-outs and hippies bring pizza and sandwiches right to your door! (I am fortunate enough to live near this location).  At first it was annoying that I would place the order online with explicit instructions for where my apartment was located only to find that the hippie delivery guy from Z would call my cell phone (sometimes I'd hear it ring and sometimes not) for further information.  Hijinx invariably ensue as I verbally administer the same instructions over the phone.  Now I just come to expect that when I order delivery from Z Pizza the guy who brings it to me will have blazed one up in the car on the half mile ride over to my place and will need some help getting to the door.  And then, the order surprise! Until they fixed the online ordering system you truly never knew what would actually be in your custom calzone.  Now it's at least got the right ingredients, although they interpret them a little loosely sometimes (last night, for example, I requested sauce, sauce, and more sauce and they gave me only one tiny cup).   I love the calzone with wheat crust (I love that you can get wheat at all), the turkey sandwich with cranberry, and my husband loves the Santa Fe pizza (which I personally find a little revolting).  The food is tasty and they bring it to my house.  I like that.  It's better than ordering from Pizza Megalopolis or some other insanely corporatized chain.  Even though Z is a chain they "keep it real" and operate like a mom and pop.  Plus they keep our local Granola Crowd employed so they can turn around and spend their cash at other local spots.    Gotta love the Z.

gnZNLvfRdPt87rBq7s3rhQ.text: Love the Thai Chicken pizza! They are the best.

g02i0CzCbhpjD72a8Os5-g.text: Nasty and cold. If you're not ordering pizza that has been sitting under the heater for awhile, then you'll be waiting for quite some time to receive your order. My mistake of ordering pizza that has been sitting for too long because it was gross.

zVqoCqqmDxv4gyBBEbZEDA.text: I love being able to get a slice of pizza whenever I feel, but I wish that they had a waitress that wasn't as condescending during the entire order process. Strictly transactional, doesn't really talk to you, and sends you off on your way with some fine vegetarian eats. I really love the food there, the salads even are amazing, and with better service, it would have been a 5 star. They should be lucky they don't work for tips!

yrDogXQyouFrnjqWMcnk2A.text: At first I didn't think much of zpizza, but after going a few times and trying out a couple of the lunch specials...I'm hooked! zpizza is the only pizza where I look forward to eating the crust.

gGoftjhGrIjDj4CaiMbd_w.text: Good pizza. Great fresh ingredients. Good thickness on crust. Even taste good the next day cold.

HndiSC1xTyPaM7DVUUJr8A.text: What I am about to say is going to be both hard to believe and incredibly shocking, but True. Completely, utterly, and brutally honest. Ready?  I would rather Z Pizza than any other thing on this planet. More than food, fame, wealth, love, sex, beauty... need I go on?  I have heard some less-than-stellar things about Z Pizza, so I have been giving my business (not THE business) to Pizza Heaven, but one fateful night I took an elevator ride with a Z Pizza delivery man who explained that they have both gluten free crust AND vegan cheese. It was awkward being that I had a Pizza Heaven equivalent literally right in my hand, but the delivery dude handled it with poise and handed me a magnetic business card.  Well, today it is rainy and I'm drunk and I was hungry and I didn't want to drive, so I gave Z Pizza a chance and I am so happy I did because my life changed today.   Let me repeat that: MY LIFE CHANGED TODAY  This pizza, despite it being abnormal in every way possible, was the most delicious culinary specimen I have put in my mouth in MONTHS. Get the Mexican (sans chicken and sour cream, of course)... you owe it to yourself. You really, seriously do.  I love this pizza so much that in future trysts, I will fantasize about this pizza instead of my lover. I really will.  I hate this review because I cannot even articulate the words to do this pizza justice. I'm not worthy, I'm not worthy!  Oh, and PS... when I ordered they told me 45-60 minutes and it was here within 30. That's better than finding a rich guy that dresses well, doesn't have mommy issues, and is straight up hung.   Did I just say that?

qQR-xhfUAfMlcdbne1jyEQ.text: Mmmm......piiiiizzaaaa.....  I got the Groupon and tried this place out for the gluten free pizza crust option. It wasn't the best pizza I've ever had, but pretty darn close! I ordered the Italian, which has a hefty portion of artichoke hearts and black olives and I would have devoured the entire thing on my own had it not been for that pesky husband of mine.  The gluten free crust is an extra $3.00...be forewarned if your hardcore about keeping gluten free though. They aren't very careful it seems about cross contamination and I'm not positive, but think they might have used the same cutter on the regular pizza's as mine and there was flour everywhere. Kind of defeats the purpose of eating a gluten free pizza IMO, but I'm willing to take that kind of risk. I like to live on the edge.

zfp30H1XtC80ufDpwNR5Mg.text: Warning: Request crispy crust or you may receive a soggy pizza! My pizza was delivered soggy with toppings that weren't even held down by the cheese! Imagine my struggle trying to eat it! If it had crispy (or at least firm!) crust, I still would only give the place 3 stars. The flavor of the pizza was so-so, and the buffalo wings were greasy and lacked flavor.

XwY4gwL7_2hriPqoy9sqyA.text: I did receive a message from ZPizza and was sent the $10 gift certificate. Thank you.

f5pJdDgUrNS4TexqxngbPQ.text: One of my top pizza joints!!! Always friendly service and never lets me down! Today I came in on free upgrade Tuesday and I didn't know it was till it was offered to me! I was so surprised! I just love this place so much! I came around 6PM and the two guys were super cool! You guys ROCK!!!!

c2eDK1BszLyq1JhKhwJnDA.text: When i lived in phoenix. We came here all the time well at least once a week but usually more.. This location as well as the down town location. We generally got take away from Thomas location only because seating always seemed cramped and stifling. How ever we did enjoy dinning in at Zpizza down town. The pizza from both locations always was delicious. We loved the fact the zpizza offers whole grain. Very few if any pizza places do. Also we appreciate that they use  high quality ingredents. I only wish Zpizza were here. So i could enjoy their yummy pizza again.

nNNKrxCVcElIAIiq7jqzeA.text: I live in San Francisco. I made an order to surprise my boyfriend who lives in Phoenix and they did it perfectly. And my boyfriend said the pizza was really good. I am really pleased with their service

6XCz0gXzvaq7QNw_jrva0A.text: This place has good vegetarian options and is organic! Try the vegan cheese and vegan toppings like crumbles or sausage!

46uqBoVPNFh9uyz5Ash9Jw.text: Never disappoints! I can count on ZPizza for a healthy, quick and cost effective lunch in a clean and friendly environment.  The menu has many options aside from tasty pizza. They never disappoint and I'm glad they are a stone throw away from work.

IgFwqiFlB5El4e6hyzVicw.text: LOVE Zpizza!  Their pizza is amazing (ZBQ is my favorite) and different than what you get from the large chain restaurants.  They also deliver and their delivery has always been FAST for me.  I also love that I can get a tasty salad to go with my pizza, which makes me feel a little less guilty ;)

z6S7HrNVYn-rTOvfr6athQ.text: Pizza was ok....undercooked at first had to request it to be cooked for additional time.  Service was very slow....better places to go

iXxvinjm5UgwAjUQFrEhoA.text: It is the best pizza.   Great for all types of people.   Vegans, vegetarians, gluten free and all natural.   My daughter got my husband and I hooked a few years ago and now I can say is the only pizza place that we'll go to.

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VG639qVRVjRhA12QtYqHMA.text: A friend and I decided to meet here, I've been before to the place next door (the Pink Spot where they have homemade ice cream, desserts, salads, wraps,ect...)  We sat on the ZPizza side and ordered a veggie pizza with no olives. Service was quick, friendly and helpful. I love a crisp, thin & tasty crust...and this was pretty good!    I'll definitely be back.

FBOyB2uIBsZbye8OpUls4A.text: Ordered a couple of pizzas for delivery. Gave them the order and the credit card information. They call back and say we are out of the delivery area. What is your delivery area I ask because you delivered here the last time we ordered. His answer was 5 miles. Oh according to Google Maps we are 3.7 miles from door to door. Oh well.... he said we are not going to be delivering your pizza with his ever so snippy voice. Now that's great customer service and rudeness to boot. I guess they think they are the only pizza joint around. What changed between this order and the last is beyond me. Do your self a favor........go else where. Federal pizza is closer and has way better pizza, but now I have to go get it. Oh well Z Pizza will never see a dime of my business again. There is no need for rudeness.

5eERt_Npedt_DeoTjop5BQ.text: This is my favorite pizza place. I wish the pizza wasn't so expensive, but I understand why it is. I love the Hawaiian and the California Veggie.

s5ys8sJf-yi5A_8HwiVGMQ.text: One of my favorite local pizza places! I love the vegan options! Pro tip: log in and order online for specials and occasionally I'll get coupons and a birthday offer in my email because I signed up. Worth it!

IC_lyZB3v_9EwRq-DDGbaA.text: Probably the worst pizza I have ever ate. The prices were alright until you find out you were better off going to little Caesars. The "buffalo" wings had no buffalo sauce aside from one wing and they were rubbery and had no flavor. The pizza I had requested be made fresh but that would not cure the cardboard tasting pizza with what tasted like old ingredients. By far the worst $22 I ever spent on pizza. Another over rated disgusting downtown pizza place.

7o3uR1mvdsA12JLOBKR01w.text: First time I had ZPizza in a while. Customer service was horrible. Started when we walked in and not one person greeted us. I was ready to order and the girl that helped me seemed like I was bothering her. I order two slices of pizza with no drink. (I wasn't not aware of their specials.) I found a table and waited for my food. When the girl came with my food she dropped the food off and walked away. After the same thing happened with my friends, they asked why I didn't get the lunch special (that was two dollars cheaper for the same food including a drink). This made me angry that the girl who took my order did not mention this.

BSQa9w-h4EMiZdwTixqorw.text: I usually really love the vegan pizza, but today I got it by the slice and it was horrible. I got it to go and when I got home 5 minutes later, it was cold. I don't want to give them less then 3 stars because I really like the place. But I spent way too much money on cold pizza that didn't taste good anyways.  I'll probably go back, but I am never getting pizza by the slice again.

lKZuhwO7CCNsSJjwNzfwEA.text: Underwhelming, both professionally and food-wise. May have been better had it not arrived cold and soggy (from sitting out, I'd assume). I'd look elsewhere.

jdHPNB_8cNUMNxyZX77Frg.text: This place is okay for the price. The pizzas taste a lot like back home in Chicago. Love that they have gluten free and more green options. They are nice people and the service is pretty great, which earns most of its ratings.  Pizzas are kind of expensive, though. Their salads aren't really all that special.  Also, figuring out their menu online is impossible. You have to sign up just to look at it, and honestly I don't need any more emails about anything in my inbox.  I also have spent at least $5 on a meal at least a dozen times, and I haven't forgotten about giving them my phone number but my points towards a free pizza don't add up. I wish this was somehow fixed because I feel I would be close to some free pizza, but alas I will likely continue to eat here.

xCIGjiWcWciVbVkCQqb2Gg.text: I wanted a slice and a salad after 9 p.m. on a Sunday. zpizza fit the bill. At $12, it was a little steep, but the food was decent. The staff were friendly but seemed a bit shocked to see anyone walking in. I also overheard an employee telling a delivery order that pizza would take more than an hour to arrive, but they might have just been short a driver.

LiU97XcvW0L3O3o8_OuDEQ.text: i hate going to places that i can goto near home, in Phx for the Cubs games.. but my daughter wanted pizza and we saw Z and had to go becuz we know how good it is. I like this one alot better then ours.

0djNebfOHU-3SO4PZSGNIQ.text: I don't get it. I only go there because it's a short walk from my house and fast (and Pino's is closed for weekends). I've heard people rave about this place. It's about as good as papa johns. Pino's al Centro is almost next door. Go there.

TBU25SZFgS7_aG3rGvwKjg.text: I've been here 3 times now, and each time, I fall in love with this place a little more.  Today I had a slice of the bbq chicken pizza for the first time.  Wow.  I've had bbq chicken pizza one other time, many moons ago, and the taste almost sent me to the bathroom.  But this?  This right here?  Oh my.  Sweet and savory and spicy all at once.  And of course I love their crust with the bit of garlic at the end.  It really made my day.   I also had the Napoli for the second time.  I think this might be my favorite...wait no, the Casablanca is my favorite...no, the bbq chicken...DOH! Seriously, I've never had this type of pizza, meaning thin crust gourmet.  I'm used to the big, pan crust pizza pies.  This is a treat, though it will not replace my love for pies.  It will be a new love affair. Last thing, I'm continually impressed with the freshness of their ingredients.  I've never had tomatos so sweet or mushrooms that I would eat by themselves.  Awesome stuff.

ecH4YsOwnpLlJOwByJONww.text: Well I wasn't blown over but I wasn't disappointed. The pizza is excellent, try the santa fe pizza but ask for extra corn, the staff isn't overly friendly or rude...indifferent maybe what they are or maybe I caught them on a bad night. The decor seems lacking but if you are going to pick up your pie or get it delivered this place may rank at 4 stars. Its a pizza place with a unique twist. Try it out. I'd go again it may not be my first choice but I'd go back.

gDIxUaEpdwrU8_5MqvmP2Q.text: Best pizza I've ever had! Really, they make the best tasting pizza in the world, the staff are great, and they have an ice cream store built into the same shop, so you can walk through and get ice cream desert for afters.

aD9CHuikL2tVXeMvb8hfzQ.text: Don't feel like the normal Pizza Hut or Papa John's but still want something just as good?  Order Z Pizza.  The Pizza will always be good, the only down side they have is that the price is high.

TN8fLp__wMzCw3-uQwOtDg.text: Had the provence pizza and I'm so glad I got the extra large so I would have leftovers the next day.  Pizzeria Bianco's got nothing on this place.  Interesting ingredients, delicious crust and perfectly baked (not burned).  I definitely recommend trying the hot/bbq-ish sauce they have in the condiment area on your pizza.  Not a ton but a little adds a delicious kick.  Service was good, the place was clean and the food was delicious and organic!  Looking forward to lunch today  :o)

vzdjOH1v4_MKlXEFJBue9g.text: Trend sucking expensive pizza, come on now 22 bucks for a medium 3 topping pizza.  I especially liked the counter dweeb taking 10 minutes to scan the two twenties I gave him.  Must have had a rash of middle aged men passing fake 20's.  I pass.

VKQ50iKeYennOgpKDPVfww.text: Love Z pizza. Didn't know it was a franchise. They have anchovies, goat cheese, artichoke and all those delicious toppings you won't usually find at big chain pizza stores. Can be pricey though, 3 large size pizza's set me back 56 bucks.

6sJYEIsmDOyuCU8loAqjUw.text: I like this place even if it's a chain. It is pricey (or at least more pricey than the other guys) but the pizza is great with topping options you can't get anywhere else (sun dried tomatoes, ricotta cheese, capers, etc).

2ap0y--x_Iu7799ZTvV_yg.text: How I love thee...Great for the vegetarian and vegan. A little pricey but worth the extra cash when you're used to getting crappy pizza. I rather pay extra for the good stuff. Delivery is fast and they always found my apartment, even in the alley. Way to go!

mPbTKObHlHGOk9P008310A.text: Z Pizza is good pizza.  Every pie I've tried has been super good, and they deliver ($20 minimum order).  They also deliver salads and cookies, which is nice if you want a whole meal or if you're having folks over and you want to serve more than just the pizza.  Just thinking about the fresh (and often organic) toppings, good cheese, and their crunchy, yummy crust is making me so hungry!  It's obviously a matter of taste, but I far prefer Z Pizza's crust to the thin floppy kind.  Let the hate mail begin.

vG5jIMBTLYO6SC30Rj0Uog.text: Delivery was a little on the slow side but the tuscan pizza and avocado salad w/ chipotle ranch dressing didn't disappoint.  Wish there was a Z Pizza where I live!

D_9D3TcXfUwO3vEUucpgTg.text: I have to say I was not impressed with my pizza from Z's yesterday. I stopped in to grab two slices to go and I could not eat very much. I have had their pizza vefore at their Metro Center location and liked it but yesterday it was salty and greasy and just plain yucky. $6.00 seemed a bit pricey for two slices of cheese too!

vM7GzkQxWdMsMAjzfTuDEg.text: I was at work, trapped behind the bar, and we were all out of snack chips...Staaarvving!  I really didn't want to order close to $20 worth of food to get delivered, but as I perused our folder full of menus that had delivery service, I started to salivate when I started reading the Z Pizza menu. It's a very colorful, attractive menu, and had a bright yellow sticker that said "free delivery" (as opposed to Mamma Mia, whom I love, but $2 delivery and $10 minimum, well, anyway, I'm digressing).  What to get, what to get, it sucks when you're just that hungry and all these pretty combinations of toppings jump out at you saying, 'pick me,' Little tomatoes with white gloves were high kicking like Rockettes with their arms linked with Mr. Mozzarella and his top hat and monocle. Wait, that was Mr. Peanut, anyway...So I decided on the Provence, which was described as having artichokes, tomatoes, capers and garlic sauce, in addition to the mozzarella and regular tomato sauce. I love me some capers.  It seemed a queer combination, but I love all these ingredients and was eager to have a little adventure. I called in my order, and the girl on the phone recognized me from the bar, and we chatted about the pizza, decided I should have a little truffle oil thrown on there as well. What arrived, still hot, and perfectly baked, was one of the tastiest pizzas I've had delivered in a while. The crust was so crunchy and the truffle oil had soaked into it, so it was like its own separate hors d'ouevre after I made my way to what I would normally call the pizza butt.  The toppings were tasty, fresh, and the combination was truly a treat. I don't know about the garlic sauce, it was a bit too much, but maybe in a lesser quantity the flavor would have melded and not been so obtrusive. I was a happy Kitty, and the next day, it reheated like a champ for a little lunch revisited. Good stuff, that Z Pizza. Oh, and my favorite was the little Kitty face drawn on the side of the box next to my phone number.  Nice touch.

czL_zvJtn8drJMmgwBkVBA.text: Ordered a pizza at 7:30...it's almost 9 o'clock.  Still haven't seen it.  Granted they have great pizza, but this is ridiculous!  Perhaps one of the other ZPizza locations in Phoenix would do better.

4-Mz_-3nq8aBZ7qnNCLILA.text: i love z- pizza! its so nice having a pizza place that makes vegan pizza for us lactose intolerants! the berkely, or vegan, was so good. a little bland because its made from soy cheese, but if youre taste buds feel theres really something lacking, its nothing a little pepper cant fix. i moved to sf a year ago and before i moved i went here and had their pesto-penne dish as well, and that was amazing.  speaking of san francisco, what's with the lack of vegan pizza options there?! im glad i moved back to phoenix and had the pleasure of eating z pizza AND pita jungle in my first 2 days.

LR3NrcUPUbZBHUDXcGsTpQ.text: I love, love, love the BBQ wings. They always arrive piping hot and the sauce is amazing. They have a wide selection of pizzas. A nice natural crust that is not too thin and crispy, not to thick and doughy. The toppings taste fresh and delicious. The sauce has a very good blend of flavors. I like the American and the Italiano pizzas the best. The calzones are a little greasy, but still tasty.  Delivery times are usually at least 45 to 50 minutes. However, I don't mind to wait for something good.

hJTVQWAawJFVrUb2rhoKeg.text: Great pizza, especially if you're out to feed a vegan. Yelp needs to make this $$ instead of $ on the price. It's well worth it tho.

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The ZBQ. I shoulda taken the photo before I started eating but it was so good I couldn&#39;t wait.

nFVuf44_8xNhUyGYlPyj-Q.text: My partner and I have something of a special needs diet and we're always missing pizza! Well, these guys said they had what we needed, and boy did they deliver! The pizza arrived hot and delicious, full of tasty ingredients like roasted veggies and perfectly melted Daiya cheese. If I found myself living in Phoenix, I'd probably be here every week.   My only complaint is that the delivery said it would take 30 minutes, but in reality it took a full hour.

OqqYQ4xuS-6zWs9BBbzYNQ.text: We used the online ordering system, and our pizzas took FOREVER. Ordered at 7:15pm, and they weren't delivered until 9:30pm. The online system gave a 30 minute estimate, and when we called the restaurant, the guy on the phone said the order would be delivered any minute... 2 hours later, still no pizza. Our hotel was two blocks away, and our order wasn't hugely overwhelming--2 pizzas and a salad. When we finally got our food, it was nothing special. Maybe one or two steps up from Pizza Hut?

oaMsw_1Y5UFv8GpTyVt3xQ.text: Used to go here a lot when the Pink Spot was next door. Management must have changed a lot because they don't even have a menu to look at when you order, and they didn't even understand the types of items on the menu. It said "select sauce" and there were two different marinara sauces and we wanted the one with more spices. It was called "robust" sauce and I don't know why she didn't understand me, but she took the menu from me as if I was wrong. The pizza was slightly undercooked and wayyyyy too expensive. They also had a deal for an XL pizza at a L price but she didn't offer me it and we were stuck with our smaller subpar pizza. Seems like quality has taken a dive over the years.

EHXpuBmEZOatpOnc_8ny_w.text: Love the Napoli pizza.  So fresh.  Add some sausage and it becomes a meat lovers pizza.

anROc9dGDk2MzKjuQv77vQ.text: Visited on a Sunday afternoon the guy that was there was very nice. Place was empty. Decided to get a slice while waiting for my pie. A girl was available to take my order then she put my slice on a plate. I asked her to please heat it up she said it just came out of the oven, I touched it with it was cold. She then pitched a huge attitude grabbing the slice with tongs placing it in the oven for barely 45 seconds. Again grabbing it out with the tongs angrily, toppings falling on the floor. Needless it was still cold and half the slice I ordered. Get rid of her.

M_gyX6WOX8aVlS863fp_mQ.text: Great, healthy pizza.   Zpizza has a ton of great, fresh ingredients to choose from. A lot of the sauces and toppings are organic too! Additionally the wheat crust is amazing! Oh and to top it off; they deliver.Can't beat that.   My favorite pizza here is Casablanca. I could eat entire one by myself and I am not ashamed of that. Hahaha...  It is a great place in my neighborhood when you want good pizza delivered to your home. Sometimes, you just want to stay in and enjoy comfort of your home in a company of good pizza.   Cuztomer service is grean and place is really neat if you prefer to get out there and eat!

0Z7CGHT7ppN_LSqTeAaQVg.text: I am surprised by some of the negative reviews for Z-Pizza. I've been coming here since I was in high school and have never had a bad experience. They have great lunch specials, and the ingredients always taste fresh. It's also pretty reasonably priced for what you get. I usually order a small pizza and a salad, which comes out to $12-15 depending on what I order, and I can get 2 meals out of it depending on how hungry I am.  My favorite pizzas are the Santa Fe, Chicken Sausage and Arugula, and American. There's also a good selection of toppings if you want to build your own. I love that you can also get any pizza on gluten free crust, which is actually really good. The salads are great too, especially with the chipotle ranch dressing.  I've also recently become a big fan of their delivery. You can order online, there's not a delivery charge, and there's no minimum order. It always seems to come pretty quickly.   My only dislikes are some of the non-pizza items. I got an order of Parmesan Flatbread Sticks a week or two ago and they kind of tasted just like plain pizza crust. The wings are also pretty bad. They don't really have any sauce and have absolutely no spice or flavor.

4ue3SNCzE7ZONoSzwUh7BA.text: This location sells the ice cream that was previously sold at Pink Spot (next door, before Pink Spot closed). Mind you, they charge $6.50 for a pint, which is already a little high, but worth it as it is homemade.   I frequently order from here and always make sure to get a pint of the ice cream. This last time, I placed my order as usual and what do they deliver to my house?... A pint of Ben & Jerry's! For $6.50!?! I voiced my frustration to one of the employees who said he would have the owner call me.   This morning, I spoke with Mark, the owner, who was completely rude. He stated that Z Pizza does not advertise the former Pink Spot product (Well Mark, perhaps you should tell your employees to stop telling customers that that is what it is), and that they have the right to set whatever prices they choose.   You're absolutely right, Mark... You can set whatever price you choose for a "grocery store" product. I can also choose to save my money as a customer and take it elsewhere. And to be completely honest, your pizza is just "ok" and still twice as expensive as ordering from Papa John's... Who btw, delivers in half the time it takes your employees.   Z Pizza just lost another regular customer.

MOc4018DNnfuSQphTj8vAw.text: No doubt the pizza is excellent here, but the service sucks! The first time I went there, there was a line outside the door. To their credit both registers were manned, but when it came to be my turn, the cashier (Asian female) decided she didn't want to do any more work and just wandered off. When she decided to come back, she spent the next 15 minutes chatting to her friend on her phone. Eventually she decided to serve me and got the order wrong. Gee thanks for nothing lady.   The second time I decided to call the order in. Hello Z Pizza, can you hold? Can you hold some more? Hello can you hold? Unfortunately they don't wait for you to answer before putting you on hold, so you are SOL. I began the call when I was a 30 minute drive from the place and finished the call in their parking lot. I walk in expecting the place to be slammed, but no, it's dead. More employees than customers and guess what, they're chat, chat, chatting away - with each other.   This place would be great with an effective manager in place. Or maybe just any manager

t2nAKsY7IN5GDvi6G6xjTw.text: Wonderful little pizza place full of personality. Service was outstanding, food was fantastic, and beers were FULL. Great music playing and awesome lighting. Very sweet, helpful staff with knowledge of menu. Perfect pizza date night for a Friday night. Check this place out.

o9xUNOUzGNL1U0mhmXVXSg.text: It should  be call "S"pizza for all the salt they put on their pizzas, we ordered them with light sauce, thin crust, etc. and still was soooo salty we had to throw them away after we ate a few slices. We had tried ordering the same style of pizza from Dominos and Pizza Hut and they were way more edible than what we ordered from Zpizza, We wish more establishments were more aware of the dangers of too much sodium on the products the sell...

dDrSKxl-ZH0TVicOe7xqMg.text: I am a fan of zpizza and have been ordering from them for over a year. However, this location has some serious problems. First off I called in a "catering order", specially stating the purpose of the order and how many guest would be attending. I had picked up a catering menu for the location to help make my decision. I ask the takeout staff for 8 catering sized pizzas and a catering salad. I confirmed with her that this would feed 20 people. All well and good. Day of the event the food arrives. The takeout employee hands me the food. I look in the bag a personal sized salad... This is a catering order. We also received and paid for XL pizzas, the menu clearly states large for catering (photo included). The employee left before I was able to discuss the issue so I called the store and spoke with the manager who was rude and offered little sympathy. They then redelivered the catering salad. When I went to meet the take out employee they handed me my salad and 4 completely open salad dressing. He did not mention or apologize for the issue or mess. I am so disappointed in the service and food and being over charged!! I will never be ordering again.

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Catering Menu

SX_xwhFFAfjdoJ_UoDx2cQ.text: Z PIzza - wow you let me down!!  We eat zpizza somewhat regularly, Not my favorite but the wife likes it so if we are having pizza this usually it.  In phoenix for business, went to grab lunch at the 53 West Thomas location.  Service: the service was ok, a young man that was very eager to help us took our order quickly.  Order: I ordered the California salad, trying to eat light for lunch to combat the 118 day heat of the day. The order came out quickly and they called my name.  I picked up the food and after a quick glance..realized there must be a mistake. I think you gave me a side salad I mentioned to the manager. He looked at the salad and stated no that's the California salad. I mentioned the price as a question. "This is 11 dollars?"   His reply "no, wait did you get a drink?" Me "yes" Mgr "then yes 11"  The salad contained roughly 1.5 cups of mixed greens, 4 slices of cucumber, 1/4 of an avocado, 2 narrow slices of tomato and a few black olives. Easily contained in a side salad bowl.  I didn't want to make a big issue out of it, but I did advise him this seems like a very high price for a very small and plain food, and that zpizza may get the better end of the deal today, it would be my last visit.  BTW Mr. Manager - you probably shouldn't serve customers very small portions and then justify the price and the portions while holding your personal salad that looks like it would fill the grand canyon. You should treat your customers the same way you treat yourself.  My co-worked also felt the same way, to the point he had to pick up lunch two on the way back the office.

fZowr4D0Cz7Uij7WI1xsUA.text: Acceptable pie, with some out of the ordinary crusts/toppings (eggplant, truffle oil) for a fast casual place. A little on the pricier side of pizzas. I might try the vegan cheese/crust/toppings next time.   Two tips for the reader: -   They were not aware of the yelp check in system, but they gave me a free slice anyway  - It took almost 20 mins to get a small pizza and an order of wings out. There was one other customer in to place, but it seemed like they had several call in orders.

QEvF0hMpkJTHMtXOGM-wlw.text: I always enjoy the pizza here and the staff is awesome. I've tried the wings as well and they are pretty good. I haven't tried anything else but I'd expect the other things on the menu to be of the same quality. Could be a bit cheaper, but you get what you pay for, right? They do have some weekly coupons if you sign up for their email list.

GqUZ-mfhtPztdxhPFCDAvw.text: I know for a fact there are GMO foods at your restaurant. I knew the last owners and I know for a fact that you have changed vendors, change the portions, change from yeast, salt, water and flour for the pizza dough to some kind of enhancement packets. You can't even pronounce the ingredients. Don't lie. Mark and Julie didn't go by what corporate said. They did what is best for that store and their customer base they've had for years.  So don't blow smoke in my face. I know the truth.

AfgIFpSyXuEMjXV8Aft_3A.text: Best pizza in Phoenix. The ZBQ is so good. I normally order a half ZBQ half pepperoni and ricotta pizza. Always fresh. And delivery time is quick. There's no reason to go anywhere else for pizza. I love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half ZBQ half pepperoni and ricotta.

WtTiZEPDNnTXThoYF5_9TQ.text: After coming to Z for the last 1.5 years, I have to reduce my overall score. This is long overdo.  Not sure what has happened there but the pizza is just not the same as before (see last review).  Issues are quality of pizza and price and my experience tonight solidified my less than stellar review.   Ordered to large pizzas: one Greek and one plain cheese, plus a salad for pick up. Total bill was about 45 bucks! Say what? Cough cough...holy cow!  Got home and low and behold, another feeling of my hard earned money being spent on less than average fare. Pizza dough was chewy and dry. It used to be amazing. Rest of pizza was bland and tasteless. It used to pop with flavor. See the theme here?   I just can't justify spending this kind of $$ on this quality of food. While pizza may not be the cheap alternative to feeding a family any longer, there are a dozen other places I'd rather go, spend half as much and get a pretty decent pie.  So long Z Pizza.

9tjHwZeahEThJ3IAjFw9rQ.text: This place deserves 3.5 stars in my opinion.   Pros: The staff is attentive, they offer whole wheat selections, and the food has been good and consistent every time I have been in. The pesto pasta is fantastic  Con: I think it is way over priced for what you get. The food is good but not great to warrant their prices. Second, the portions are too small for what you pay for. Unless I am jonesing for a whole wheat pizza, (which isn't often) I will go somewhere where my dollar goes further.

Va5PffITONYiQxEAZfFayw.text: Zpizza is pretty good. They do use fresh ingredients. Wings are frozen and oven baked. So they're soggy, they're not all fat, just soggy as all hell. If you don't like the texture of soggy wings, stay away. I'm okay with them and they do alright when I'm in a pinch. The Casablanca pizza is amazing! They have some really great specialty pizzas. Where as many people have Pizza Hut or Papa John's as their basic delivery pizza place, I like to choose Zpizza.

oaRqrMRyueFu6mspe6GyCA.text: So bummed usually very good but tonight my pizza was watery and not done in middle. Ur delivery is better than this . Had to try n rebake didn't work ! Yuck

M3G42oyjwtb_lPM4cQ_asw.text: I went here over 2 years ago on a date. My now fiance took me here on one of our first dates and I had pepperoni and it was amazing, but for some reason we never went back until last light. I am now attempting to be vegan (or just have a more plant based diet) and I tried their berkeley vegan pizza. I ordered it in small (personal pizza) and it was very delicious. You get a lot of veggies for the price you pay ($11) and it was vegan meat crumbles. I am very happy because I love pizza and now i don't have to say good bye to pizza, this is a very delicious substitution over the real thing.

0r25F4I_twiKXOqwZJVXcA.text: Love Z Pizza! Seriously never had a bad pizza here. ZBQ is delicious!

P7Pk0a06gZSpBPqjLhfM2A.text: For the price, for the niche, this place is good. I enjoy the 2 slice 20 oz drink lunch combo. I like to keep it simple here, the ingredients are good, simple good ingredients will always pay off. This place isn't the 5 star pizzeria but it sells slices and delivers to my doorstep. Stick to the pizza and enjoy the price and convenience.

IJlC5OUjFUN2rLccCUvUKA.text: I have been debating on posting  a review for quite a while on Zpizza, I'm torn.  On one hand, their pizzas are addicting and delicious. Their (usually) perfectly crafted and aesthetically pleasing. The best thing about them is the variety. Its no longer cheese, pepperoni or sausage, they bring new elements to the table.      BUT, on the other hand, the one thing they are truly lacking in their business is genuine customer service and communication among themselves. About 2 months ago, I ordered two simple pizzas, the Thai (my personal favorite) and the ZBBQ (my boyfriends personal favorite). Because neither of us eat meat, I simply asked them for NO chicken. I have ordered from them many times, so I wasn't the least bit worried. I waited 45 minutes for it and when it arrived my pizzas were both covered in chicken, so we obviously couldn't eat them. I called and spoke with a manger just to say "Hey, this kind of sucks!" she then told me sorry and that I can have a free small pizza.  So, still being hungry I decided to place another order (why not?). 45 minutes later I receive the same order and even tipped the guy generously for having to come out again. Well, what to you know, there's no chicken! But wait, there's also nothing else on the pizza except cheese. Awesome.  Twice in one day on the same order. This has also happened several more times since.  For me, customer service is a big part of running a business. If you keep screwing up orders because you fail to communicate with your team you're going to lose valuable customers.

fkdtu2HkNPtnMnuL31Olkw.text: being honest the review is mainly done based on a take out order that I was able to try at a volunteer event from VPA. They brought the veggie, cheese and salami pizzas.   Yes you can definitely taste the difference in the cheese, but if only they could improve a bit more the dough....that would make me feel more happy. I'm a bit picky with the dough and love the thin crisp style. Better if you use whole wheat!

X2NFJjcLU4FlQtSMWoM1Uw.text: The crust here is the worse, tastes like dirt. The staff is lazy and meh and the wife of the owner writes people on yelp if she gets a bad review being very hateful, instead of changing the tastes of food and hiring older experienced staff. Pizza is pretty gross

6Ja29TbXqbXkAt_09cubeQ.text: This is a great lunch spot with well-priced pizza. I have never tried their pasta or salads, but those look good as well. I like that they are housed right next door to the Pink Spot, with an open breezeway connecting the two restaurants. This promotes a friendly, neighborhood-y community feel. We have ordered delivery from them before, and their artisan pizzas are way better than your typical Domino's or Pizza Hut. But I would actually advise to just eat in-store, because the delivery pizza was a little cold. Overall, a great place with a friendly vibe & lots of good healthy options!

WtbWS79Ev9hPnb-9URfHhg.text: This was the 7th stop on the dine around.   I'd give it 3.5, but due to our "dine and dash", I can't completely qualify my experience just yet. We came here for the napoli pizza and waited a few minutes for a fresh pie to come out of the oven. I really liked the feel of the place, and the menu was pretty expansive and looked good.  Oh, I do have to say the guy at the register was super nice, and so was everyone behind the counter. We got our slices and I haven't had many white pizzas, but this was really good. The crust was delish and the ingredients were really fresh. I'll definitely hit this place up again in the future.

setPVDI7Zh1_ekoMt1f0bQ.text: I just took my kids to Z Pizza today and had a HORRIBLE experience. A man who identified himself as the owner practically accosted my 4-year-old. My son was holding 2 plastic knives, not hurting anyone, just holding them in his hands, when the owner charged in, snatched the knives from my son's hands and proceeded to scold him. Not only did he yank them from my son's hands rather violently, he scared the b'jesus out of him.   This was an outrage on many levels...  1) The owner charged in madder than hell. He let his anger scare a young child 2) The owner should have spoken to me first. Never were my kids unsupervised, I was sitting right there. They were doing NOTHING wrong, just being energetic boys. Let me remind you: this is a pizza joint, not an upscale restaurant 3) Even after I told the owner to stop touching my child, he continued. UNACCEPTABLE. You do not yell at or assault a child. I would file criminal charges, but I don't want to put my kids through an ordeal. This man obviously has anger issues that need to be dealt with. My message to him: Stop picking on innocent little kids!  There is no PERHAPS, the owner absolutely should have spoken with me first. My child was shocked at the way he was spoken to and is still very upset by the event. The owner let his anger get the better of him. PERIOD. And for that he should apologize, not chastise

1F8w2n3eeGol-4AWhQW1Ng.text: Young girl at the counter needs to learn some customer service... I continue to come cause it's convenient and sometimes tasty...

CRAM0DbKGWSmqlq0KetZ5A.text: Good pizza great service the cashier girl is very nice and polite she has a great smile

SlVIC_nXX2swo45DuUtKww.text: Delicious pizza, I love the crust. I took my daughter here for her birthday and she loved that there was a couch to eat on and an ice cream place built in :) The wings were good but spicy.

-q0PaZv9dWh0JX0mqlCuYQ.text: We live near Z Pizza and have ordered it a number of times recently - it's good - but the reason I'm leaving this review is because I just tried their gluten free pizza tonight, and I'm totally a fan!  I don't have much to compare it with in terms of gf, but I had a third slice ...I just wanted more!  My rating isn't 5 stars because I thought they skimped a bit on the sauce ...but you know I will definitely be back for the gf and I appreciate that they offer it as an option.

zmWo_AACBEURUSJtnEZfng.text: I've been meaning to try this cute little pizza shop forever and we finally took the plunge last night. I grew up on Papa Johns and Pizza Hut living in a small town and while I love those too, I also like the fancier, more simple pizzas that come from Cibo and the like. I wasn't in the mood for the fancy types of pizza and Pomo doesn't deliver so we decided to give it a try. After looking at the menu, I was excited to see that it was organic and seemed like a fairly healthy choice when pizza typically can wreck a diet.   We ordered the Pear and Gorgonzola salad (large), a small American pizza and a chicken sausage Rustica pizza. Ordering for delivery was quick over the phone and the total came to $30. That's a bit steep for delivery considering the regular chains have some incredible deals now but oh well, I decided it was worth the try! Estimated delivery time on a Sunday evening was 30-45 minutes.  I was pleased that the pizza's arrived much faster, probably closer to 20 minutes. The salad was large and for $8.50 it was pretty good. The balsamic vinaigrette dressing was a bit sour but it complemented the salad pretty well. As for the pizza's, neither was that great. I had requested extra sauce and my first piece of American basically had all the toppings slide off when I grabbed the piece and the dough was undercooked. I thought because their crust is advertised as thin and crispy that it could have handled it but it didn't even come close. The overall flavor was decent but the presentation reminded me of something you get at a pizza buffet. It looked like a highly processed pizza to me and I know Papa Johns is way better if I'm going to go that kind of route. I had one piece of the chicken sausage pizza and did not like the sausage at all. It looked really processed in this weird oval shape and didn't like the flavor at all. Overall that pizza, minus the arugula (because since when is peppery lettuce so vogue?!?!) was pretty bland.   Sadly, we won't be ordering pizza from here again but I might swing by for the salad sometime. One star for the salad, one star for the fast delivery.

dbBVuli6PtcYpNHRfw5hFw.text: Horrible. Service, quality, and bowel repercussions. 2 hour delivery time, 2 day toilet odyssey. Not my first bad experience either. Never again!

acq8aSQRKw_tx741dlDnyQ.text: We wanted to try something new, and we found this small little place. Great food, the pizza was delicious ( do not order by slice, buy a whole one.. It'll be fresher and taste better). And then if you are not full, the amazing part is that is connected with the pink place, where they sell desserts and smoothies. I give it 4 stars because the employees are lacking customer service skills. But good place overall

mBldByJF6OdPtu2adtxoAw.text: I'm a bit frustrated. I love the pizza, but the place is always dirty; at least, the past three times that I have been here. The bathroom had mold around the waterline in the toilet and the walls in the dining room were dirty. Now I'm not eating out if the toilet nor off the walls, but it doesn't make you feel good. Today I went to sit down at 4 different tables, having to continuously move due to the crumbs on each table. So, choosing the bar across from the cashier brought me closer to watching how they prepare the pizza. The guy wears no food handlers gloves! Just hands on cheese on my pizza! No thanks! Fare Z well!

h700jDRoa4fMh7zkMXFIrA.text: Good pizza and good gluten free pizza. A little bit expensive. One time I ordered to go and instead of giving me my pizza or asking for me by name they put my pizza under the counter and let me wait an extra 10 minutes before I asked what was going on. Would have been a 5 star review if not for that.

Xxhkeh4hW8XpkpJjctgukw.text: Yikes, we wanted to grab a bite before my brothers baseball tournament, we're in town visiting for that reason, and we were going to go to the pizza place thats in the plaza next door but my mom was sure that because there were more cars this one would be better. After eating here I highly doubt it, now my mom isnt the easier customer to deal with BUT i always talk right after her to clear up what she was saying and this guy wouldnt stop talking and just listen so he kept repeating exactly what I just told him. The pizza comes already made so they put it in the oven but we walked to the car and pulled away and it was still mostly cold, which made the pizza taste worse than it probably was but still it wasnt good. I got pepperoni and I ate it because I was hungry and as soon as I was done I became VERY sick to my stomach to the point I feel like i'm going to puke. My mom and brother both didnt enjoy theirs either. You won't catch me here again thats for sure!

05FtYZIb0ovxoPp1UiNPwg.text: Calling all VEGANS! Been dying to try their Vegan pizza and today I finally did. I'm actually still eating it while I post this... and man oh man, it's phenomenal. Since transitioning to a vegan diet, pizza has been what I miss the most (well, besides hot wings). Honestly, you wouldn't guess this was vegan if you didn't know it. So much flavor. Crust is awesome. Service was fantastic also... younger kid served me and was so polite. I will for sure be back to dive into this pizza again! Delicious!

a-6mIkHLkYTN_1YMroJ8zg.text: The best vegan pizza in Phoenix! The Tuscan Mushroom one too was amazeballs!   It was perfect after we did the wine walk and was a bit tipsy! I'm still dreaming of those two pizzas!

Q28VpqDw9OYBxUlB9kWApg.text: Good pizza. The pizza that has artichokes and fresh mozzarella on it is amazing. Was a bit hesitant with it but they came through with a job well done.

p3QQnXRGpGbtiP1_y7F0jQ.text: Yum!  Fresh ingredients and flavorful crust made this small yet inviting places my favorite near office go to!!!!

bjzkq80dEZEioC_yCiqCdA.text: I made my first order from zpizza without checking yelp and now that i have, I'm kind of surprised by the 3.5 star rating.   We've had zpizza delivered a bunch of times now via Grubhub and the pizza is always yummy with good ingredients and quick delivery.  Can't go wrong with the zbq and they also have great pesto options. We'll keep going back for more.

dGq2k8-IRJMB2jbucOW9fA.text: I've been here 20+ times in the last year as my wife really likes it. Their pizza is good and they have several interesting non-traditional offerings.  We really like that they use organic and non go ingredients in their offerings. That being said, I'm not sure I can continue to get pizza from here.   I've noticed over the last several months that the service and especially the attitudes of the employees is becoming worse and on occasion somewhat hostile. Tonight was the final straw for me. I was told my order would be ready for pickup between 20-60 minutes. When I arrived after 30 min, it was ready and the girl almost threw it to me across the register. I asked for the salad the id ordered as well and she looked at me as if I had three heads. Reluctantly she walked the three feet and got my salad too. The entire experience tonight put such a horrible taste in my mouth that I can no longer recommend Z Pizza to anyone!    EDIT:  Spoke with Brian, store manager, who recently took over this location. It seems like I got caught in some transitional pains. My wife and I will be going back soon and will update review at that time. Really appreciated Brian calling me and am looking forward to seeing the improved ZPizza!  EDIT2:  We went back last week. Night and day difference!!  Spoke with Keegan on the phone who was incredibly pleasant and friendly. When I arrived to pick up my order, the bearded man who makes pizza greeted me and was friendly too. He actually looked happy to be there. The young lady who was cashier that night was still standoffish at first but slowly warmed to polite conversation. Such an improvement.   Brian, you are doing a great job in turning this place around. I feel I can recommend your restaurant again.

hhYoYYfB8IdpEZmQ_0ZAzg.text: I am a first time customer.  I ordered online.  I called in 25 min after I ordered to ensure that I had given them my gate code. At that time I asked how long before it's delivered the young lady said 20 min that they were waiting on the wings. Well 30 minutes later I called and the driver still hadn't left. I was then told that they were making an exception for me because I was out of area that they deliver as if they were doing me a favor. Again I placed the order online.  When the food finally came another 20 min later (totaling an hour and 35 for what was quoted as a 45 min order) the food was burnt to a crisp Cold and hard.  There was nothing cheesy about the cheesy bread at all.  And when I immediately called the manager Brett said 20% off my next order. I spent $44 bucks on the worst food I've ever ordered with bad service like hell I'm ordering again. Woooow!! Definitely thumbs down!

qLyipozsP0vLhsmbC4Whpw.text: Ordered delivery from this location and I was impressed. I ordered two half salads and a small Provence pizza with chicken sausage.  The pizza was cooked perfectly, and was not soggy at all, despite being delivered. Growing up on the east coast in NY, I am used to and prefer thinner crust pizzas. If you like thin crusts and organic ingredients, ZPizza will not disappoint.   The salads were good too, but they were nothing special.   Overall, I am happy I gave ZPizza a try and will order again!

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Small Provence ZPizza with chicken sausage.

jANhmA_6IppPZJoWJNontQ.text: Wasn't bad....the lunch deals are great.   You can pick 2 or 3 items.  Pizza, salad or small sandwich.  Prices were great compared to the area.  Food was good and service was fast.  Went pizza and salad combo.

ZsxBzCRwcv1sLVfEtlnwUw.text: Chronically late with GrubHub orders (30 - 45 mins), accepts GrubHub orders past closing time, leaving me to wait.. where's my order?? GrubHub listed phone number is disconnected. Get your act together!  Will not be ordering from your store again!

The Moroccan pizza with the best pizza I've ever had, who knew to put pine nuts on your pizza:)) The mushroom and cheese pizza was mediocre. But it was still good, we sat in the pink spot side.
