8pWoPiP1yOsPSR5omB4uNw.text: We ordered Chicken Alfredo delivery.  Yuck it was terrible!!!  I added mushrooms, onion, garlic and Parmesan cheese and still it's inedible!  Don't order this!  We had pizza from Z's that was good, this, however, was not!

Fxvez3Xf9zBGaBuubWAjEA.text: My family and I went there last night to celebrate my cousin  Graduation.         It was probably 20 or more of us my aunt suggested we are hispanic we weren't  to happy with the idea of going to a pizza place. But Hey surprise we got the best pizza ever Ham & Pineapple , Mexican with avacado pizza we order a big salad bowl more than enough for everyone my parents were at the bar they all got to try and pick from the draft beer , we were all very thankful everyone was very friendly and attend, a very warm and nice place to have a nice dinner with your family I will definitely go back ...

XlRrFh4ZEX2Rop_3X7AQ_Q.text: Pizza is good. Service is ok. When I tried to cash in on the free pizza slice on yelp check in, they tried to charge me $2.50. Something about how it rang up in the computer. Other than that, this is a nice cozy pizza joint with flavorful fresh items.

lzCMw7CrClcRFAid8yYXQg.text: I ate here thinking it was a normal pizza by the slice place. I ordered pepperoni thinking that was a safe choice. The pizza was MEHHHHHH... but for $8 it was alright. Barro's is still better pizza by the slice...  THE BEST PART of this joint is the lady who took my order looked like she hated her life and you could see it in her mannerisms.

RHO7lqzdv6zdQ4A2kE0Fww.text: I love this place and often stop by for the Tuesday upgrade special. Today I called in for pickup as I usually do and my order was confirmed over the phone. I get the same thing every time and they usually just use order history to confirm. When I went to pick up my order I noticed it was much smaller than normal after paying. The super nice guy at the register apologized and asked the guy making food in a hat and with glasses how long it would take to remake it correctly. He obviously heard him but completely ignored him. He asked again 2-3 more times and nothing. Finally the guy in hat and glasses (Jeremy maybe) grabbed the ticket out of the other guy's hand and just started making the pizza over again. I tried to interject and say I didn't have time to wait I just wanted the difference or a cookie or something. The guy at the register was again super nice and I apologized to him for having to deal with the other a-hole in the back. Not only did this guy mess up the order but was as rude as he could have been right in front of anyone viewing. He should be terminated and never be allowed to treat people that way or represent your establishment again

NFdFtQlzOyC3VePBJJtgQw.text: I am not a fan of thick doughy pizza and bland sauce. I almost always order the casablanca for me, sausage for my kid and hubby likes the pesto pasta. The salads are great, and large portioned. It is pricey but I am willing to pay extra for what I think is good food.  Not 5 stars because lately when I order for delivery they have made quite a few mistakes.  Oh I almost forgot! They now have wings, and let me tell you, they are to die for! I ordered two different kinds of sauces and both orders just came with Ranch (doh!) but even without the sauces these were the best wings I have had in a really long time. I am personally not a fan of wings because they are usually overcooked or have a strange fatty consistency and these were just awesome. I would love to try them with some the offered sauces so hopefully next time I get what I order.

As3A5Tb1t4ArOmZAWIsQ_Q.text: When I have the craving for pizza, which isn't that often, Z Pizza is the best spot in Central Phoenix.  Our guilty pleasure is ordering on Tuesday nights when it's buy one, get the second for $5 (or is it half-price?  some kind of great deal)....and eating pizza while we watch Biggest Loser.  I'm always a fan of pepperoni, and their crust is crispy thin...the best way.  Also like the Casablanca...artichoke hearts, mushrooms, ricotta, parmesan, mozzarella...so tasty.  Great to have Gluten-free crust as an option, and the ingredients are fresh.  Yes, it's a small west coast chain...but they do it "right".   Friendly staff, speedy service, easy location.

NX0tGyCIgWYb64r-h1gLIg.text: I (and co-workers; friends) have eaten here so many times over the last 6 years that it's about time that I write a review. Everything I've had here is great; I highly recommend the California salad, add chicken; balsamic dressing.  But every pizza I've had here is great too (a rotating selection), as is the Caesar.  I've also had a sandwich now and again and can't complain. Every once in a while the pizza has been sitting there a little while and is a little dry, but that's pretty rare, especially given the number of times I've eaten there. And hey, every 20 times you get a free pizza - can't beat that. (OK, 20 times seems a little high...)

b3EcmUeXYXW_ITLvTOyOiQ.text: If you like great pizza and good sandwiches then this is the place for you. Try the Polo Latino!

gbEj2qPzw39FH3gANs-iUA.text: I have had nothing but a fantastic time with both the staff and service! I love the pizza

vgyMizUym4tM0l8pVEhwDA.text: They have interesting combinations like curry chicken and yams, pear and gorgonzola....sounds bizarre, but is so flavorful! The traditional choices are available as well, along with great salads and unique sandwiches. Organic whole wheat crust and fresh ingredients make for a great pizza! Friendly staff is an added bonus.

TocMcNMvdgDBlSY7LUXU6Q.text: You rawk my chain Z. Can I call you Z? Like when I'm hanging with Oprah and I call her O. She gets a kick out of that. Listen. You goofed up a little a few weeks ago and omitted the sausage on my pizza. I was cranky and rattled off an email to corporate. Just cuz it wasn't the first time. And, well, it was my time of the month. I'm in the biz so I wrote a constructive, non-cursing email. Not only did I hear back from the owner...turns out we hang in the same circle. So, last night I took advantage of a discount, ordered my za, spoke with a very cool, helpful manager and got the pizza of my dreams delivered. Along with some sweets from Pink Spot...see review below...pizza and ice cream sandwiches...DELIVERED...in Phoenix...merits and update, a shout out and when I win my Academy Award, I will mention you. Z. Later.

H0j-Mwk7xwmg6PzMAHn03Q.text: Went in with date for dinner, our first time inside the restaurant on Thomas and the place looked clean, but not any special decor or anything.  I did order wings and pizza (large) with traditional toppings and two beverages for $35 and paid upfront.  The wings were covered in sauce and turned out well done on the inside but somehow the skin was wet and soggy.  Gross.  The pizza was a thin crust which is good, but it too had lots of "juice" under the center of the pizza making it soggy and the juice looked like black water.  Gross.  A waste of $35!  A side note, the service was so poor from the cashier dude that thinks he should be given a tip before the food is even served.  He also made a verbal comment out loud that he was working for free.  I am sure zpizza has quality ingredients, but the wings made us both sick for the night which means another lost customer telling a hundred others not to visit this hole in the wall.

dI9oHyo2lVr_djVbYobDgg.text: Good pizza - crispy crust,tons of toppings, and some creative combinations. Stopped in when stranded at the hospital across the street and would happily go back to this location or try the other locations.

gpvet8MHqhkWfDucczMMEQ.text: Fantastic pizza, both regular and gluten free. Plus free local delivery. Really good tuna sandwich.

DfEREN_5RPlZY6mi_WcP-g.text: I really think ZPizza is great! I love the hundreds of choices they give you in creating your pizza! They have the best variety of pizza toppings, sauces, and crusts to choose from! My favorite pizza creation is on whole wheat crust with organic tomato sauce, soy cheese, jalapenos and  veggie sausage on top. It is so good! I also do not feel as guilty eating ZPizza as I do at other pizza joints around town! Thank you Zpizza for being so delicious and great!

S24hCSN2U3Wk2vrxQWt0Hw.text: I really enjoyed the Moroccan pizza, delicious flavors!  They have a fun variety to choose from and they threw in some extra pieces of pizza for my friend because we arrived close to their closing time.

Ne7fusBdQznQaV8YZWSeJQ.text: Ordered the Berkeley Vegan pizza here recently.  Very good -- lots of veggies, and came with Daiya vegan cheese on top also!  The crust was a little but underdone, but still good.

ON3HGOjxo0-nC9l_vLlnCg.text: Z Pizza is one of my favorites in the Valley.  You get two fresh gourmet slices and a drink for $6 something.  They are always friendly as well.  Definitely try Z Pizza if you haven't yet.

Ik67tulAQkBYjoyfSTuTtA.text: There are so many things on this menu that I love - the pizza is delicious, the salads are fantastic... and now they have beer!!!   I remember when they had room for two tables when they first opened, and now - wow - after the expansion, it's just a great relaxed place to hang out.    Wall-to-wall people over the lunch hour, no surprise!   YUM.

y36QhjS6wNxJ5qYaQHokUQ.text: Pizza here is delicious and service is awesome. My favorite pie is the Casablanca minus the mushrooms and add sausage. Delicious!  My food was ready to go when I was told to pick it up, which is something most pizza places can't seem to get right.

vC_2dkbrNXOCQIXSAWRg7w.text: I'm not sure why I held back on the 5th star before.  We've had consistently good service and the pizza is always delicious.

-aKIZOc6J7SB3gUYGNAlKQ.text: Exotic combinations of pizza.  From to A to Z, Z pizza is Z best!!  Must try the thai pizza and the Napoli one.  I love that the pizzas are all from organic ingredients, making the flavors much more intense.

1jTzfwHQa02tBJpwX3RB_Q.text: Bland pizza.  Not particularly horrible nor particularly good.  Staff that cared more about what's playing on the tv screen than keeping the tables clean.  But a nice space otherwise.

X5iAbdIxbACss7FRS9bnag.text: Was introduced to this place at a street fair and it is pretty good NY pizza. I figured if it could be that good at a fair the restaurant must be wonderful! BAD mistake since I am now addicted to this place.  I love their chicken and Yam Rustica pizza, for a change in pace.  Good place for the foodie in me, bad for the waistline. They have just opened a "Pinkspot" ice cream in the same store and the Tahitiian Coconut milk sorbet is outstanding! If coconut is not your thing they have A Kuaui Pie ice cream that is good too.I Don't understand the bad reviews.I am from Ny and pretty Picky about pizza and this place is pretty good for Phx standards. ( not Ny but who is in Phoenix?) Not everyone likes Good Ny pizza so that could be why some people did not like it. Also the rude service comments, really surprised me. I go here a lot and I am treated like family on every single occassion. I have never had bad service or bad pizza here, not once!  WOW! I wonder if the bad reviews are written by people who have vested interests in other pizza places? Sorry for their bad experience but if you Do like Ny pizza( not everyone does I agree)  you should  try it out. ( Probably not the Rustica, since that is not very Ny but get their slice special, which is a good deal. They have a 2 slice special and a 1 slice with a salad both with drinks and under 6 bucks!!!!!!!_ the only bad thing about the specials you have to have what they already have premade. Sometimes I like a choice but to have their pizza is a good trade off. Happy eating.

nyR8NMoRhdqqFi4BwwgsPQ.text: Phoenix has some of the best pizza in the world (oddly enough), and this chain simply doesn't hold up to the competition. In fact, a few steps down the street is another pizza joint which easily blows Z away.   I first had Z Pizza in Long Beach and I thought it was pretty good. That was in Long Beach. It just doesn't cut it against the many unique pizza bistros that litter the valley.   The pepperonis were a little flavorless. The sausage was decent, but nothing special. The crust was fine. The cheese and sauce were also nothing special. It's nice that there's a connected ice cream shop if you want to eat a bunch of cheese and bread and grease and then chase it with a bowl if sugar and cream.   To be honest - while I was eating it, I couldn't help but think that it was extremely overpriced. Right down the street was a better pizza place using better ingredients and costing less. I actually felt like I would rather be eating Peter Piper Pizza if that says anything.  The place was pretty clean even though it was busy. The staff was nice and friendly as well. It's not bad pizza at all - it's just nothing special.

8RKzS71oZV3EqF5r2xc64Q.text: I've had a love/hate relationship with zpizza since moving to the valley almost a year ago.  I like the idea of a healthier alternative to pizza and the salads are also delicious.  The combo with a slice, salad and drink is a great deal and I've eaten there many times for lunch or dinner.  I've always found the pizza to be OK...not great,  but just above mediocre and with the good price and great salad, I've found it to be a good option.  It's also nice that it's (usually) fast, so you can eat there in 30-40 minutes if you choose a pizza slice that's already prepared in the case by the front.  This was the driving force to my husband & I choosing to eat there recently.  We had an hour to get to a theatre show and needed dinner.  zpizza was on the way, so we decided to try it.  There wasn't a line to order and the dine-in area wasn't very crowded.  We both ordered the salad/slice combo.  While ordering, a 1/2 pepperoni 1/2 something else pizza was placed in the case.  I asked if the pepperoni slices were available (as they weren't on the sign) and the cashier said yes.  We both ordered pepperoni slices and paid and sat down to wait.  And wait we did....salads took a bit longer than usual and when they brought my husband's it was covered in dressing although he had specifically ordered it dry.  I think the guy expected him to be OK with it and eat it anyway, but he really doesn't like dressing.  He sent it back and had to wait again.  After finishing our salads, still NO PIZZA.  I went up to ask what was taking so long to heat up 2 slices, and was told that the pepperoni was not available so they were making a new pie.  I told them we picked it b/c it was already made and we were in a hurry, and they were now telling me 10 MORE minutes for the pepperoni.  I asked to switch our slices to the Napoli which was in the case, which they did.  They heated those up and served them with an apology, but a rather apathetic one.  Unfortunately, those slices didn't taste great, but we choked them down and ran out the door to be barely on time for the show.  I just don't understand why they couldn't have told me the slices in the case weren't available and that there would be a 25 minute wait.  At that point, we could've ordered a whole pizza or chosen a different place to eat.  Also, the employees all seem a little bit snobbish and don't seem to care a bit about customer service.  I think I'll be taking my pizza business elsewhere in the valley, which is unfortunate b/c zpizza is so close by.

C1Usubb_VByMnerJxDGxsw.text: This place really needs to be trashed more.  zpizza is a fraud in too many ways.  It markets itself as a sort of whole-foods, higher-end, indie urban culture-vulture sorta place.  It wants you to think it's a cut above.  And it's none of the above.  It's in reality a corporate franchise chain, with a few tweaks to its menu to make it look a touch Berkeley.  It's in a rather inaccessible part of north-of-downtown Phoenix, but they deliver.  The prices it charges for pizza are an outrage, their ordering system goes down too often, and they deliver a cold $25 pizza and then ignore you when you complain.    The ingredients it uses are largely not organic, but they want you to think they use high-end ingredients.  If the flat flavor of their pizzas is any indication, their ingredients come off the same Sysco truck any other middling restaurant's groceries do.    One time I tried to order online, the system choked.  I called and they said, "We're sorry we're closed - our ordering system is completely down."  On a Saturday evening, they couldn't do business without computers.  Wow.    Another time, I ordered an American large, and discovered that they charge a lot extra for everything you add to your pizza.  And everything comes in the most paper-thin slices, so thin you almost can't taste it. I had never experienced see-through tomato slices before, and it was also my first encounter with windowpane pepperoni.  The crust is chewy, which is ok.  But there wasn't much food on my pizza.  It was thin and meager and not satisfying.  And it cost a lot of money.  Oh, and the sausage looked like perfect little weasel droppings, smooth and brown and perfectly formed, as if by machine - or by rodent.  They have whole-wheat crust and gluten-free crust and too many salads with stinky cheese in them and fruit too I think.  So if your probation officer said you have to eat more pear and gorgonzola gluten free pizzas with extra arugula, well, you can stay outta jail one more week.  Next time (why did I have a next time?) again, online ordering is down, but they take phone orders.  I am given a 30 to 40 min del'y window.  After 60 mins I call and ask.  Am told it's on the way now.  It arrives 20 mins after that.  I grab the box and it's cold.  I mention to young street-urchin-looking delivery hipster that my pizza appears cold.  I ask him to wait a sec while I open and check the pizza.  He bolts away and into his car before I can ascertain that I have a cold pizza and cold wings.  I wonder what the delivery guy was up to all that time?  My pizza had been baked some time before.  Perhaps he had been too.  While the slices were microwaving, I called zpizza to discuss and was told manager is unavailable.  Message is left for call back.  I also left a detailed accounting on their online form, and I never heard from anybody.    Again, people, this place tries to whore itself out as a high end, even crunchy place, the kind of place you'd take your lesbian-married-with-adopted-Chinese-baby friends, so you could look just a little less pathetically uncool than you really are.  But it is just another chain using smaller amounts of the same goods as everybody else, adding a few upscale salads to the menu, and charging 40% more than everybody else.  And they have unacceptably poor customer service.  Go to Pizza Hut.  Really.  Aim low and you won't be disappointed.  Oh - and Pino's next door has good and more authentic pizza too, but you gotta pick it up yourself.  Or if you can, get Rosati's - the real Chicago one.

0pLS_bBJ0tCMpWghS-or5Q.text: Cheese pizza has probably been my favorite food since I was a kid, so my pizza reviews tend to be pretty tough.  I've eaten at Z Pizza a few times, although mostly out of necessity because the pizza shop next door doesn't take debit cards!!!    Z Pizza has a great atmosphere, the staff is always very friendly, and they deliver in a timely manner downtown.  However their pizza is not my favorite.  There is something about their sauce that I just don't like, and the pizza is always pretty greasy.  I can usually make it through one and a half slices before I have to put it down because it just isn't "scarfable" to me, which a good pizza should be.  Their salads are pretty good and they have a decent vegetarian selection across the board.  One plus is they sell Ben & Jerry's ice cream, and how can you possibly go wrong there?

TAzIGhuDj-HTObwtiKd_sQ.text: We love this place. We eat here every year when we visit Phoenix. Very kid friendly. Great salads. Since they do pizza by the slice too everyone gets what they want. Best part is it's attached to the Pink Spot.

2XQRD7n68xbLXdHLcfEU-Q.text: Love the gluten-free options and late hours, thanks!

FhI8D8SDg6QHZ2EUyKalQg.text: i wouldn't spend my money here any more.  food is average  This is odd but I've eatn Zpizza four times, three of the times its been take out from the hospital where we all threw in to get a few pizzas but my last experience was at the Thomas location and there was a girl employee that seemed to cough all over peoples pizzas and she didn't cover her mouth, gross (she must be a smoker)   Good bye Thomas Zpizza, never again

-qKJFoXAudI5xABowjGgNg.text: Being from the East Coast, it's extremely difficult to find good pizza here.  I live less than a mile away from Z, and I'm grateful to have found it! I love the toppings!  They even have a white pizza, which nobody east of Lake Erie seems to know about! The staff is always friendly.  I like going there by myself, reading the paper or New Times, and chatting with the staff while I wait for my order. Yes, price is higher than most, but I'm willing to pay for it!

suwD9ep0lc7hY0xQMi7czQ.text: Food is a tad high but the wings and pizza as well as the calzone were good. The  help was friendly and out food was HOT when brought to the table.  The music was actually decent and not to loud. The place seemed clean and they had a steady business for a Sunday night

KKPesnztQEXazgAvtXpGsA.text: I wasn't going to review this because so many people have already and most everyone says the same thing... awesome pizza.   I miss working so close to here. The lunch rush is a rush but you get in, you get out. And everyday is different, I can try all their different types of pizza. Personal faves: Sante Fe and Napoli pizza and the chicken pesto pasta.   While the pizza speaks for itself, I do have to give zPizza props for having the best specials.  Cheap daily specials, slice of pizza and a drink (or beer) for about $6, buy one get one for $5 on Tuesdays and of course, the frequent eater reward.   I like a place that offers great food and even more reason to come back.

N5iOyD3AmVOaQbRquUVCvw.text: I am disappointed in Zpizza. It used to be my favorite but the staff might have changed ( i usually order by phone). The last 3 times ( yeah...that's how much i eat there) have been not so great experiences. They have not been their pleasant selves over the phone. The lady who answers is almost always off put and the gentleman with the older sounding voice is not very helpful. How hard is it to take an order you ask? Well, apparently pretty difficult.   More customer service, less bad attitude I say. Don't treat me like a second class citizen over the phone. Just saying. Pizza Heaven for me from now on. Not to mention their delivery is VERY FAST. And the guy who answers the phone at Pizza Heaven actually seems to ENJOY his job :) What a concept   Ciao Zpizza. Our relationship is overrrrrr..  Although I must add, the delivery guys at Zpizza are super cool dudes

xiCEpq_Ri8Y2oBC_j2JrBA.text: deliciouso....great crispy, slightly burnt edges. they weren't frugal with the toppings and were more than willing to add or take away any sauce or topping as we wanted. very friendly staff and quick. cool artwork on the walls, and extremely reasonable for the middle class foodie.   several valley locations so check one out in a neighborhood near you. then head next door for a tasty ice cream treat.

-vtx4zqjvUfHHRRvadn4vQ.text: Good pizza, they are fancy.  Z Pizza received my attention after received a door hanger.  Z-Pizza his really opened my trust to direct marketing.   Also check out their website its really clean.   Open late, this is a rare trait in the valley my thank yous to all restaurants open late for those late night munches.

wzOgtcS7paJTzn2LyrasCw.text: Soo yummy!  I agree with the fact that parking can be a pain here, but its worth it.  Or, what a lot of people don't realize is that they deliver!  The pizza is a little pricey, but for the different toppings and styles they make, it's totally worth it.  Personally, I don't really like red sauce, so it's nice to find a pizza that doesn't have that as its main ingredient.  Come here (or get delivery) if you are looking for a non-traditional pizza that you want to really enjoy!

K_4ILA7_oDxk3s83GSeP_A.text: I've had their "3 Z" lunch special a few times. Usually grab two slices (I've always gotten the daily specialty pizza) and a half salad. $7.99 and it fills me up for hours.

OaMBNKbLOhlZSOR_C89ZtA.text: Sit down and grab a slice anytime! Love the rich, mouth watering taist of all their pies!

RaJJUnfPeBtWEa7tG82DAw.text: I love Z Pizza!   I go here all the time with my coworkers. They have great lunch specials. I always get a slice with a salad and drink for around $7.

IEslw1ieH9KosUXWqbWfcg.text: I really like the joint, but the food is hit or miss. The staff is very accommodating & I dig the location & the vibe inside is cool.

zOtTIbdrOaQhfgiZETaF_g.text: After putting out a twitter alert for a pizza place along the Lightrail, my fellow tweeters urged me to check out Z Pizza.  Even before my tweet, when I was at the Mayor's coffee event at the Heard Museum (yesterday), we received the Phoenix Passport Book.   My friend, Seth, told me that there was a coupon in the book and we should try it out.  There's no doubt that Z Pizza had to be a place I needed to try this weekend.  Instead of taking the Lightrail, we decided to drive.  (FYI, the closest Lightrail stop is Thomas and Central and it's only a short walk away.) We liked the friendly service and the comfortable atmosphere.  We ordered the Hawaiian Pizza and it was yummy.  We ordered the large because with the coupon, you get $5 off of a $20+ order.  The large pizza was $20.56.  We ate a few slices and took the rest home.    We sat and ate on their comfortable couch. Afterwards, the setting was so comfortable, we stayed and read our books.  I wanted to try the desserts at The Pink Spot, but I was too full.  All in all, Z Pizza had a nice atmosphere and good food.

5NOeVYHdFYvbzA2AGAoJbQ.text: I love the ZBQ and on Tuesdays they have a special - buy one pizza at full price and get a second pizza for only $5. You can save about $15 on your second pizza with the special - it's quite the savings! Don't expect super friendly customer service here, you won't get it.

0BKRtsA1q_DquBUYx8OM_Q.text: I love mom and pop shops and especially when it's pizza! It made it even better that they have a vegan option! It is a pretty small establishment though; cozy, but I think I'd rather get my food to go each time because it would seem to be claustrophobic if there were at least 5-10 more people there. Located in midtown, so it's in a great location!   I went with my mom for lunch and it was surprisingly no one else in there (kinda had me skeptical) but I still wanted to try my first vegan pizza. I set my sights on getting ONE slice of pizza, but apparently they only offer the vegan slice if it is one of the pizzas of the day, otherwise you have to buy the whole pie. I was a little disappointed but my mind was set on the pizza so I just ordered the whole pie anyways, and not regretfully!  It took a little longer than expected to get our pizzas since we were the only ones in there but I guess you can't rush perfection right? My mom ordered a slice of the American pizza and a slice of the Bacon Spinach Mushroom pizza and I ordered the Berkeley Vegan pizza. All of the pizzas smelled really good! My pizza was so impressive, I feel like I could get used to vegan pizza and not miss cheese at all! Although the cheese is clearly not the same texture, it tastes more like a thick "sauce" than the hearty cheese that most know and love. Besides the cheese, all the other flavors were there and went well together! You could (almost) not taste the difference from a regular pizza. My mom really favored the Bacon Spinach Mushroom pizza with the white sauce and artichokes, she said both were good but that one was REALLY good.   I really enjoyed this place and wouldn't mind coming back again to order the vegan pizza, it will just take some getting used to the "cheese" texture! Customer service was great, they were helpful and I love when the staff makes suggestions. Although the cashier seemed a little new and took awhile to ring up our order, I appreciate everything the workers did to make it an enjoyable first visit.

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The vegan Berkeley pizza. Sooo good! Small $10.95

vclDwyzlKXMt2Z-aQL9VNw.text: I went to this place with a groupon but unfortunately I can't even use the groupon because the staff never seems to not want to serve. The first time I went I was told that the restroom was out of order, not a big deal...but they did suggest for me to go the restaurants near by and one that is half a mile away to use the restroom. I go outside to the near by ones and all the restaurants where already close. I figure while I do all the walking around and look for the restroom by then they already would have taken the order...but when I got back from restroom adventure it turns out that haven't even taken the order yet. ( my husband was inside the restaurant while I was gone) so we left.  The second time I went there I couldn't order because once again no one takes your order. So I left again. I'm just hoping that groupon refunds me. :(

03RFpnnYDyTmp8hYL-YFVA.text: Excellent menu with numerous options for apps, salads, pizza and more.  The crust is so good and light.   Parking: This location at W Thomas Road has maybe 5-7 spots for parking. However, when we were there, we noted most folks get to -go pizza.   Service:  Fantastic and friendly!  Also, I used a Groupon. Some restaurants are weird with Groupons, but this place was so so friendly!  The man who had made our breadsticks and pizza was always asking if we needed more wine and/or beer.  So friendly!  Food:  I have ordered pizzas here before. The crust is light and tasty. It is light weight but filling.   I ordered the arugula salad, which was a bit heavy on walnuts but ok. The Caesar salad looked super tasty.  The mushroom pizza was light and interesting.   We ordered the parm breadsticks and finished those rather quickly.   The menu indicates that individuals can order gluten free, vegan, or vegetarian as well!   Price: Great prizes for what one can get. Lunch specials are very cheap.

GJa_XqTqSCqkGm18oOipVw.text: Soggy gluten free pizza with a steep upcharge for gluten free. They don't tell you about upcharge or what it is. It was about double what is usual. Apathetic staff. I would not chance it if I were celiac. Shared kitchen. Staff really could not be bothered to speak and seemed genuinely irritated that I would ask a question about the sauces on some of the pizzas. They never even asked if I wanted a beverage.  Pizza not worth price. Sauce has best gf pizza. I would buy a frozen  gf pizza at a store before having this again.

aT2umXgoju1GX1HWG5I0ZQ.text: My sister is vegan, so any place we go to has to have vegan options. I've passed by this gem so many times and never gave it a shot. I'm glad I took the chance because the pizza was amazing. OMG, THE CRUST!!!! You know the pizza is going to be delicious if they have nailed the crust. I could not stop eating the crust; it was a perfect balance of chewy and crispy.  I got the pepperoni pizza (boring, I know), but probably one of the best pepperoni pizza's I've had in a while. My sister got the Vegan Brooklyn, and she stated it's the best vegan pizza she ever had. I will definitely be back. Everyone is also very nice and willing to make recommendations.   Plus if you're new to the location, they are doing $5 dollars off if you dine in. I don't know the exact rules, so make sure to ask.   I also did not get pizza by the slice... I'm sure its the same, but nothing beats pizza fresh from the oven.

Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brooklyn vegan!
Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GTAHBRNxfUF6j1lNv6Tr2A.text: The pizza is really good I'm not gonna lie. 5 stars for the pizza. Now the cashier personal sucks. I'm sorry he needs to be more ethic, friendly and have more knowledge about everything. One more thing don't believe on the coupons on any website because they make they own rules when u want o use them. We were a big bday party celebration and we were told to keep it down, he gave us this weird looks and to kill it he wanted to o te charge my friend forget pizza wow . So order to go and make sure u look at ur receipt before u sign.

eHNM3qIkM4yqFH0ISvpCDA.text: I was craving pizza and wings and could have ordered from any pizza delivery place but I thought... Why not... Go one up  and get delivery from here.... I ordered wings and pepperoni pizza.... When they got here (65) mins later.... The bag that the wings were in  were translucent... Drenched in  oil.... I said "what is this!?" The driver said oh I must not have closed the bag enough " when I opened the wings up.. They were soggy, covered in  oil to the brim " and freaking disgusting!!!!!!   I'm so mad I paid $10 for these.   Also, the pizza was oily and disgusting too! They must have put about thirty pepperoni on a small pizza.. Which left it beyond soggy.   I'm mad because I never had nastier tasking and looking food than this.

D0H_SlgmLtqFqKu0x31I9w.text: The staff is very friendly! This is my go to place for a little bit more formal type of  hang. Their wings are delicious, and their chicken pizza is the best!

J7dVOh43BCVOPmh1wVa8kw.text: Go there at 440pm the cashier in front told us sit and he would take our order. Ten minutes later brought our drinks. My wife order a glass of water and received this picture. It was in total 44 dollars. A xl pizza and 16 wings when I received the food. I asked clearly is everything in there. I asked is the Parmesan and peppers in there with napkins. And is everything good with the wings? The guy said yes. I get home excited been wanting to eat pizza and I opened my wings and no sauce. The wings were dried. So I had to make my own sauce at home lol. I called them and the cashier answered the phone. He didn't even say anything. I'm upset. You only had one job? Make sure the product is good. For Gods sake. You got a raise with minimum wage going up a few dollars in az and you still do a lazy job. Ugh! Never again will I go there. Thanks for ruining it.

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States

069N9QBigDJ6e6y80EvDWg.text: Wow this place is really on top of things.  We walk in and no one even acknowledges us. After a few mins we ask if we are to be seated or we seat ourselves.  "Go seat yourself." - cashier  While sitting in a completely empty restaurant, a few employees see us but none even come over to ask is what we want to drink or even give us a menu.  Fifteen minutes later we go to the cashier and ask if anyone is going to give us a menu or at least bring over water. He doesn't say anything and just hands us menus.   I say "No, we're just going to leave." His reply is "There are menus on the tables and I told you to order up here."   "No you told us to seat ourselves, not to order up here. Also there isn't a single menu on a single table."   Once again, were the only people in the whole restaurant. The employees literally outnumbered the costumers.   With such stellar costumer service, I'm sure this place will be out of business soon.

S-bSEseA88erIbDkG4RBfQ.text: I started going here after our son was born at St Joe's hospital a few doors down.  I like the atmosphere and that there are some more exotic pizza options on the menu than most other places.  Probably still not as healthy as a grilled chicken salad, but the ingredients lists make me think I'm eating healthy.    We order delivery now and then, and have always been well satisfied.  My only critique is I wish there were more specials and deals.    Yesterday our family received a soggy mess of a pizza that we ordered from a well known national chain located not far from Z's Thomas Rd location.  Maybe they're not a local Arizona business, but Z's is my pizza place of choice whenever there is a location close by!  Never again will we order from those other guys.

B6eGU1hMhHCV59U5SrJhtQ.text: Yummy pizza! They were out of vegan cheese so I went without cheese and they gave me an extra topping and a free vegan cookie!  Fast service even though I showed up 45 minutes to closing.

qADLC8aHXNyhB4zCkUceSQ.text: Very nice whole wheat pizza crust options, love the taste. I am allergic to white flour and don't prefer gluten free ( loaded with potato starch and sodium  sometimes unless they are made of whole grains like quinoa, brown rice and gluten free ) and hence opt for whole wheat. There are only few pizza joints offering that and hence z pizza is great for folks like me.

0Clt_q2NsfYUknCDUpvoqw.text: The first time the pizzas were awesome and we felt like we finally had a solid pizza spot especially since they could deliver, but the second time it was just okay. The wings weren't cooked all the way and had no crisp. The barbecue pizza was decent but nothing to brag about. Where doing to give this place one more chance. Will see what happens.

pbUBgCfDgwmvTfBZG04ycw.text: This pizza is next level and the space is cool and chill. My wife loves her vegan pizza. We will be back soon

hViFuzZP8oBefI8wgjtchQ.text: After placing an order online through Grubhub and buying a Groupon, I came to discover (only by driving down there) that this location is no longer open.

X3-5znL9wQJORoDlodF92Q.text: **FINAL UPDATE**12/11/14 I never received a reply from Brandi Babb. I would consider this closed after this much time. This company is horrible even at a corporate level.   10/23/14 I was able to make contact with the corporate offices of Zpizza. A woman named Brandi Babb sent me an email asking how she could help. I have detailed to her all of my updates and information about my experience and how little this location has done to make the situation right. I will post her response once I have received it.  UPDATE 10/18/14 I just received an email from the BBB advising they still have not received a response over a month later. BBB has closed the case and states this will have an "adverse" effect on ZPizza's rating. I was provided horrible service and even worse product and still, I was not refunded. Great job ZPizza. You've shown what type of business you really are.   UPDATE 10/10/14 I just got an email from the Better Business Bureau and they say ZPizza still has not responded to them. ZPizza also has not made an attempt at contacting me. BBB will give them more time to respond before closing the complaint.   UPDATE 09/17/14 I have filed my complaint with the Better Business Bureau today. I waited over a week for zpizza to call back and they didn't. I called them 09/16/14 and spoke with a nice girl named Harley who gave my information to the GM. The GM called me back on 09/17/14 and left a voicemail and didn't give his name. He defended what Sean, the manager in training, told me and said they won't refund me since I waited until the next day to file my complaint. He said "this is the end game" and declined my refund request. They've wasted more money responding to my complaints than the pizza is worth. Update coming soon....  UPDATE 09/10/14: I contacted corporate and they have forwarded an email to the owner resolve the issue within 48 hours.  UPDATE 09/09/14 ZPizza is making it impossible to get my refund. The manager, Sean, said, at the time of my call, that it's been "almost 24 hours" since I was there so they can't refund. I went to ZPizza right after work to submit my complaint. It had been maybe 17 to 18 hours. He says the sauce is organic so it evaporates into the cheese. He says the pizza was cooked even though it was cold and the vegetables were raw. I am waiting for his callback since he has to check with the owner to get approval for a refund. As a business owner, why hire a manager if you give them no power? They offered me a free pizza which I declined. I hate this place and don't want to eat there again. I want my money back. Next step is corporate and then the BBB.   -------ORIGINAL REVIEW-------  What a terrible experience. To order, it took the order taker at least 5 minutes because he didn't know the computer. He was dressed differently from all the other employees. I'm guessing he was a supervisor.   I specifically asked him if he would call our name when our order was ready. He said yes and said it'd be ready in 15 minutes. We waited 25. When I got tired of sitting around, I walked up to the register and the man seemed surprised and very quickly handed my order to me. It had been ready for an amount of time but we were never called.   Got home, cheese was rubbery. Ingredients were undercooked. Also, NO PIZZA SAUCE. What's wrong with these people? I put it in my oven for 10 minutes and it looked better. Taste was a 2 on a 10 scale. Again, no sauce. I would have gone back but, after waiting 20 minutes for my order, I was starving and didn't want to turn a simple pizza trip into a one hour ordeal. I posted some pictures of my pizza for the skeptics. I read good things about this place and am greatly disappointed. Over $20 for one large pizza and this is what I got?
