Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No sauce on my pizza.
Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horrible pizza. Cold, no sauce, ingredients undercooked. I had to put it in the oven at home. I&#39;m never going back.

h3LeVqzte0_nII4Dbv2DUA.text: 5 bucks for a slice of pepperoni. Get over yourselves. It tasted bland and boring, I'm glad I only bought one.

GFVk1Vw7tevgiMUFHOh0_g.text: Meh. This place is alright. I always say even the worst pizza is still good pizza because well, it's pizza.   This place was alright. I ended up getting the thai pizza. The flavour wasn't bad, it seemed fresh. The only thing i really have to complain about is the service. The manager working the counter was extremely rude and treated his employees terribly in front of me. Also, my pizza crust was charred, like black. I hadn't noticed that until I had got to the drive in theater where we were taking our pizzas and couldn't do much since we were all starving by that time. Definitely would be into trying a different pizza place next time i'm in in phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Zpizza

6Ua70wtOvRoK3QpmKyPcHw.text: 5 star service and 2.5 star pizzas .. 3 stars overall. Just across the street from work I find myself coming here too often for the diet I claim to be on.  The benefit of ordering in ahead of time is always a plus. The food is almost always done in 5 to 10 minutes. The service is top notch and I cannot tell you the number of times the staff has stopped me from ordering some cold stale pizza by the slice   I wish they had more healthier options and more vegetarian options to go with the menu.   I updated it to 4 stars because I was just told of all the wonderful veggie goodness I cab now spend my money on ! Guess where I will be going for dinner !

6CGVTwIx2cxOA4qP89fO5A.text: This is a great place for lunch. I always get the 2 slice and drink special. Can't go wrong with awesome pizza.

JZnjhzLDH_dtiofKh9Oxiw.text: Only 2 Stars: Z-Pizza on Thomas: Haven't been here in a while because we have been going to the nearby FIRED PIE at Park Central instead, which is waaaay better!  But I received an e-mail for a free small pizza for my birthday, so we decided to return to z-pizza for that. I ordered the Thai Pizza & was disappointed....  The peanut sauce lacked any yummy flavor, quite bland, & it was missing one of the toppings that it was supposed to have....no carrots. I complained up at the counter, & to compensate, they gave me a free drink. That was nice of them, but they should have told me up front, & not assume that I wouldn't realize that one of the toppings was missing, because I used to get the Thai Pizza all the time & I remember lots of carrots on it!  There was hardly any red onions or bean sprouts on it either!  However, there was a fair amount of chicken on it.  I will not be returning to z-pizza again.  FIRED PIE, here we come!~  Also, the chairs make a LOT of noise there when they're moved around...annoying!

jPICs8gb6jP1iDEYPl90Mg.text: There was a bone in my meatball after they burned my sub the first go around. When I brought this up to the manager he said " well we do not make the meatballs here, they come in pre-made". I did not receive an apology or any effort to make it right, or keep us as a customer. We will not be going there again.  It is sad as Z Pizza looks great from the outside, however the food is average at best, barring any foreign items in your meal, and the service is unorganized, and lacking any courtesy.

LB3YJpslTdcDh40RfrjfLg.text: Looking at the last review, it must have been a "bad manager" weekend at Z Pizza. On Friday we ordered for delivery online. One hour later lukewarm pizzas arrived.  The order was wrong. Apparently they manually transfer the data from the online system into their ordering system and completely botched it.  We caught the driver before he left and he said he'd to back right away and the manager would call to tell us how they'd make it right.   Over an hour later, no call.   We called them and spent 20 minutes on the phone. We got no apology, just an excuse, "We're so busy. We've got 30 people in line. All businesses make mistakes."  They offered to write down somewhere that we were owed a free pizza.  Seriously?! Like they'd proved their order system worked well enough for that.   Very poor example of restaurant management and customer service.

7Yf724xCvZ3mg8rW3uhBOg.text: These folks are my heroes. For over a year after first moving downtown I suffered by ordering Pizza Hut for delivery, thinking it was my only option. A neighbor enlightened me. I called Z Pizza. The first time they delivered something to me, I almost wept with joy. You have to understand how much pain and pizzatorture I went through before seeing the Z light.  Not only do they always deliver on time, but their food is among the best I've had anywhere in Phoenix that delivers. I select something different from the menu almost every time I order, and I've yet to be disappointed. The delivery drivers also tend to be cool dudes.

H0INdIMwCuU3yV9EYkpdKA.text: The husband was so excited about the gluten-free pizza we had last week, that he asked me daily ever since to get another one.  I finaly relented.  So we called and ordered the exact same pizzas: one large SAUSAGE and mushroom and one large gluten-free pepperoni.  The girl on the phone informed us that gluten-free only comes medium. What?!?!?  Then she tells us that the order totals $4 dollars more than last week. ???  Then we start wondering, who was wrong? Was it the guy last week who allegedly gave us a large gluten-free that my husband loved and somehow didn't get sick from, and a onion and mushroom instead of a sausage and mushroom?  Or, the chick who seemed to be on the ball this week?  The order came rather quickly, which was nice.  My pizza was correct this time, and it was just as mediocre as the one last week but with the right ingredients.  The husband's pizza was indeed a medium and it only took one bite for him to realize that the pizza last week was NOT gluten-free.  This pizza had the crust that he anticipated last week, not good.  Not good to the point that he stopped eating the whole slice, pulled off the cheese and pepperoni and fed the crust to the dogs.  We are extremely pleased and incredibly surprised that the gluten-full pizza did not make him sick.  But, the pizza is dissappointing and not worth the $20 for a large pie.  At least now he has realized this, and we will not order from them again.

wyC6OLoxRQTO9brHd8jZTw.text: How s the Pizza ? I,ve no Idea . After fiquireing out the web site , put in the order , get a call from the store to confirm the order , I waited 1 hour 20 minutes and its still not here . I called the store , Oh he left 25 minutes ago with 2 deliveries . Ok Cancel mine , you can imagine what its like once it get here after 30 minutes . On a Tuesday night There has to be an easier way to get Pizza than ZPizza . Gooood Bye Zpizza !

565lWLYzMW5D1YKVWUpbHQ.text: The hubby and I finally made it out to Z Pizza over the weekend.   I ordered the Moroccan and my husband had the Greek pizza. Both pizzas were very tasty. The carmelized onions and pine nuts on the Moroccan were simply yummy!  I think the prices are a little high, but the pizza is pretty good.   There weren't many customers in that night which made for a nice and quiet dinner. The feel of the place seemed pretty laid back to me and I felt comfortable.  The serivce was fast and friendly.   They have a small, but great drink selection, offering Sweet Leaf Teas, Blue Moon, Stella Artois and of course fountain drinks.  I will definitley be back to try their other pizzas out.

FRbsO4fmlKDoaipmsuji9g.text: Although our piza and salad was delightful, we had the Pear and Walnut salad and the Pizza Napoli, the staff was kind of smug and unfriendly!!  We called before going, at 8:45pm, to see how late they served and were told 10pm.  We arrived at 9:35.  The girl said, "you know we close at 10 right?"  We told her we would eat quickly.  She replied, "I have to mop the floor, but we have a big party back there so you should be alright".  I found this a very unpleasant way to begin our visit here.  I mean it wasn't like we walked in a 9:55 and expected 5 star service.  After all, it is only pizza and salad.  Anyway, I let it slide.  Then, when the guy brought us our pizza, I had noticed a "New Times, Best Pizza Winner" sign, so I asked him if they had won this year.  He smugly said, "Oh, I'm sure several years".  I thought that was a crappy way to answer my question, since I am very familiar with these awards and didn't remeber them winning ever.  Apparently they one the reader's poll once back in 2007.  Whatever.  I might go back cuz the salad was bomb.

HC3HJpIlEsQufSlcke3s7w.text: Some things good. Some things not-so-good. Overall I'm actually a fan of Z Pizza.   Please DO NOT go to Z Pizza if you seek authentic NY style Pizza. That would be silly. Did you really expect a big Italian guy named Vinnie to toss you up a pie at a California style healthy pizza joint? If so, get real!  Please DO go to Z Pizza if you would like "pizza style" pizza with cool ingredients like fresh artichokes or zucchini. I also love the wheat crust or soy cheese options. Plus, they deliver to my house so fuck yeah for that.  The Yuppie Veggie sandwich is SICK in a good way. It's really good! Please stay away from the tuna salad. Yukers. Somehow it was soggy.  The service has always been pretty good although food can take a little while. Good effort!

YhfkAdbzt1DVwUzqAXRqqw.text: We tend to order the Napoli and add pepperoni.  My ideal pizza is more along the thinner crusted east coast variety than the thicker pan pizza approach.  Z Pizza makes it the way I like it.  The crust is great.  There have been a couple of times when the pizza seemed a little greasy, though.    I also make pizza at home and have gotten pizza dough from Z Pizza -- this when Trader Joe's decided to stop selling dough -- and will now always buy my dough at Z Pizza.    Ordering delivery over the internet works flawlessly.

IBWK-RgpAzsydSLY-zFvig.text: I know there are tons of other great pizza joints in town, but the Z is ranks very high on my list.   For starters, I used to work in the Qwest building less than a block away so I have a plethora of experiences with this location...and all good things to say about this particular loc.   They're always on time for one. I'd call in my order before lunch on a personalized pizza and it was always waiting downstairs in the lobby no more than 25 min later. They always got my order correct, although sometimes I'd get kinda topping crazy. I'd add like 8 toppings and they always get it right.  Zero complaints with prompt service here. I tried a few other locs around town and it's whole different ball game. So take this from me that this is the solidified location.

yiZPpzmaEnDBGQ0vT_Tzlg.text: Ok, I just had lunch there. The place is clean and the staff is friendly, but most of all, I am paying for my food, right?   Maybe I've been spoiled by the Pear Gorganzola salad at the one on Tatum, but I wasn't pleased with my pizza/salad combo today at this one.   The garden salad was actually a lettuce salad with two tomatoes. It was weak. The pizza wasn't as organic tasting as I had hoped for. I was hoping for that fresh taste, but I got a Dominos taste. Disappointed. Maybe I should just stick to the Pear Gorganzola salad. Infact, I am craving that now!

gBxRnx7JJwRpDANc5NfqIg.text: I'm about to write a review for a restaurant that I've never actually set foot in. Don't report me just yet! I've had their food many times, but solely via delivery to my place of business on multiple occasions.  The pizza offerings are fairly typical, but they do it right. Salads, pastas and sandwiches are also available. I ordered a tuna sandwich from them recently and I'm sad to report it was very disappointing. The bread was stale and the tuna was dry.   "Well that's what you get for ordering a tuna sandwich at a pizza place!" you might be saying. I wanted to see if they could pull it off. A for Effort is all I can say. I'd easily order their pizza again at the drop of a hat, though.  Someday I'd like to go in and see what Z Pizza looks like... dare to dream.

EoJGdOx97J2e8TW6AmdylA.text: I'm not really sure why people don't like this place but I love it.  I am so happy they put one downtown finally.    Their sauce is a very sweet marinara.  If you don't like sweet, I can understand why you wouldn't like the pizza.  You can get about 4 different kinds of mushrooms on your pizza as well.  The topper is that you can get ricotta cheese on any pizza or calzone.  I personally always get a calzone with ricotta, mozzarella, black olives, portabella mushrooms, and italian sausage.  It is the most wonderful calzone ever.  The wife usually gets a pasta or a peperoni pizza.  She loves both.  The Thomas location also has an ice cream shop attached to it which is nice.  Usually the staff is knowledgeable and the cooks are consistent.  The Thomas location is also usually full of doctors or nurses which always makes for interesting conversation.

YAUeOWkg9FvnKN25uioJGw.text: Z Pizza wasn't quite my favorite pizza place in Phoenix, but for delivery, it was the best option for me since I had a ridiculous amount of vegan/vegetarian/allergic to everything friends...It's a California chain, but I don't think many people know that. As Lola M. mentioned, there aren't very many parking spots and the "vegan" cheeze here...might not be entirely vegan. Don't quote me on that though! The only selling points for me were the fact that it was close to my apartment, a friend of mine was the delivery guy, and it catered to those who had gluten and veg issues. My order: Gluten-free crust, Chipotle sauce, soy cheeze, mushrooms, basil, and avocado. It can get pretty pricey, but if you've got dietary woes, then you're probably used to paying a little more.

Kdq0GUhRtPKvdH_W0J5LdA.text: I considered giving Z Pizza one star but I thought I would be more generous than one of the staff members was to me.   In New Times there used to be a coupon for a free slice of pizza.  I saved my coupon as it did not have an expiration date.  One day I sauntered into Z Pizza and presented my coupon and ordered a soda to go along with the pizza.  I was told by the clerk that I could not use the coupon because "too many homeless people" were using the coupon and they no longer honor the coupon.  I am not homeless nor do I "look" homeless.  Instead I was told I could order a special that included two slices of pizza and a soda.  I won't ever forget the woman behind the counter who so coldly denied me my slice of pizza.  I promised myself that I would never return.  Few months later...  I thought to myself "Self, you should really give Z Pizza another try.  Maybe it was just a bad day."  I called Z Pizza and asked for a delivery of a half soy and half regular cheese pizza.  In the past when I had ordered such a pizza, someone from Z Pizza was kind enough to mark which side was soy and which side was regular.  I thought the same would happen. I was wrong.  I received the pizza with no indication as to which side was soy and which side wasn't.  I called Z Pizza and asked about their soy cheese pizzas without telling them my predicament.  I was told "Our soy cheese pizzas are so good you can't tell the difference between regular and soy cheese."  I proceeded to explain that in this case, I needed to know the difference and asked why it wasn't marked.  The woman on the phone asked "How are we suppposed to do that?"  I stated that in the past the soy side of the pizza was marked by a white piece of plastic that served as both to keep the pizza box from caving in on the pizza and it also served to indicate which side was soy.    I asked to speak with a manager after I realized I was getting nowhere with the woman on the phone.  She told me I would need to call the following day if I wanted to speak with someone in charge.  I then asked them to send me a small pizza with only soy cheese as a replacement at no charge.  I was told that they would call me back once they got the ok to make me another pizza.  They called me back and stated they would give me a small soy pizza but that it was on the bottom of their delivery list and insinuated that it was not a priority.  It took another hour for them to deliver the small, soy pizza.  Customer service at its finest?  I think not.  Not only did I have to think for them and offer my own form of compensation for their inadequacy but it was the second time that I had been treated in poor manner.    Save your money.   Come to think of it, I think I give Z Pizza just one star.  I will not bother ordering from Z Pizza ever again.

_LpCOLD07DhxrN1NsK_NfQ.text: I was recently introduced to Z Pizza and now I can't get enough. I really enjoy the variety they offer but my favorite thing is the pesto sauce!  They rotate through different pizzas that you can get by the slice each day or you can order your favorite full size pizza.  My Kids live this pizza. My picky eater says it is the best pizza she has ever had.

3tM5_lW6kJNZJe_aiG0Qcg.text: some of the specialty pies are ok, but the slices are overpriced AND OH DEAR LORD DO NOT EVER ORDER THE WINGS. they are the worst wings i have ever had. not crisp at all, im pretty sure they were cooked then left in hot storage. gummy, gooey, these are not words a wing afficiando wants to hear.

feSYSdpalKUdnme_0K-0Uw.text: It's interesting that people love or hate this place...  I don't like that it's a chain - not necessarily cause i hate chain restaurants or anything but moreso because it's deceiving, seems so local and independent (I can get over that tho).  I've only had salad and cheese bread here - but it's been good both times. In theory, I like that everything is organic but really I'm not that much of an organic snob so I could be over that soon too.   All in all, I'd say this place is good - not necessarily great. But I hasten readers that I've never had a legitimate slice of pizza from here. So maybe I just need to give that a try.   Their tea is good!

JNCS3wfmehnBw7mY11ue0w.text: Tonight for dinner as a zephyr blew from the west, I ziggzagged through traffic and zeroed in on ZPIZZA!  The restaurant seems small but there are actually quite a few seats. The lighting is nice and ambiance is like an old country store. It is a pizza place, not the Ritz... so no frills, but lots of menu options.   Most people came, picked up pizza and left instead of dining in.   Zpizza has a pie for people like me called "The Berkeley Vegan" and I ordered a big one with triple vegan sausage.   The chef zealously zapped my zesty pie in the hot oven. It was covered in vegan cheese, sausage, and fresh veggies including zucchinis.   It emerged from the bake with the crust golden and perfect, and it was delicious.   It's a treat to eat a good vegan pizza! I really hope ZPizza sells many many of these and becomes zillionaires. Zya there sometime!

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Xen01UqwjHkulW9_Hsfxkg.text: You've got to be kidding me. $28 for this??? I could've bought a better one from the freezer at the grocery store. I can't even right now. Save your money.  UPDATE: The owner saw this review and sent a gift card to cover the cost of another pie. I must say, it was waaaaaay better the second time around. Still don't know if it was worth $28, but it was tasty. Plenty of sauce and cheese, as well as toppings.

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2 inches of crust without anything on it?? Seriously? No cheese?! Complete garbage.

yugQJa_YKVxeqYxHFqT9DQ.text: Please stop eating at the pizza chains and come to Z Pizza.... this smallish pizza pub is adorable and delicious. Pizza slices also ready and side salads are great.

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZC_cug0hIRh7mnW9UEYB9w.text: 3rd visit since new ownership or whatever. If you like pizza with at a mildly good crust or sauce, avoid Z!  The last pizza I just had was definitely a 2 star pizza.

gp7I90yk0gDr9E7Exklb1w.text: Awesome pizza! Best we've had since we have lived in Az.! Service is awesome owner is super cute, real Italian New Yorker!   Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SDVkf9VaeTm9ne9ceSt-EA.text: This used to be a favorite pizza spot near me, but they must've changed management or something. I have tried ordering online, and that yields an error message saying "You cannot place an order online at this time, please call the store to place your order." Okay, that would've been cool for you to tell me BEFORE I entered all the order and payment info, but whatever. I then called the store and got an automated message, "Please press 1 for pickup, 2 for delivery." I pressed 1 and was placed on hold, only to wait for about five minutes and then the call was dropped. It's like they don't actually want me to buy from them. So I will just go to one of the numerous nearby pizza places that aren't nearly as expensive and are often better quality. My advice is to try Pizza Heaven on 7th instead of wasting your time with Z Pizza.

gZx04Tb3QVehAlVDDPT-eg.text: I love this place and am so glad it's back open.  The food is t anything amazing but it's good and fast.  I love that u can get a slice AND a salad.  So many places in central Phoenix are one or the other.   I will frequent this location likely every other week.

HVekEQiJVekdcOgEGLq6Mg.text: I just called and ordered a small pizza (only me tonight) and the total came to $16.02. I was fine with that believing the order was fine and would give the driver a $4 tip to make it an even $20 ish.  Received a call ten minutes later and the same order taker tells me I need to order more because I'm not meeting the minimum $15 order cost for a goddamn 3 block delivery. I respond in shock since $16.02 is more than $15, right? Then she tells me the pizza is only $12.00. The extra $4.02 is the delivery charge. I need to order more.  And if I picked up the damn thing it would be about 55 minutes. Are you kidding me??? First, you screw me by charging me $4.02 on a $12.00 pizza and then you're going to take an hour to make it.  Who the hell comes up with these rules? Needless to say, I will not return and you can weigh losing a customer with years of loyalty over $3.00.

MNXccYPmrYAeN-vQ6-VmcA.text: Went for lunch had a simple pepperoni pizza, service was fast and prompt the atmosphere was nice with country playing in the background and the parent trap on tv!  I recommend for anyone needing a quick solid bite.

Safp8-5-6ZylPEDHe8joEg.text: I ended up downtown today dropping off some parts for work, and stopped into Z pizza for lunch . Grabbed a pick two combo : a slice of pepperoni and a half turkey sandwich, and a drink ! The food was amazing and it was under $10.

gxNGrORuEyq93meTgzTlbw.text: The cookies here are amazing lol the walnut pear salad is to die for and most the stuff here is organic!!! The pizza is also bomb. BTW it's BYOB! Woo

FOwbkUbqwvMg9ThxJOkZxA.text: Zpizza was always a go to place for me. I like their lunch specials and the place and restrooms are clean. Their pizza taste really good.

bJ69ZF7mozX347qkAH7g1Q.text: What makes good pizza?  For me it's the freshness of the ingredients,  the amount of toppings, and how well the pizza is cooked!  At Z Pizza, they make their dough fresh daily! This is huge because the crust comes out like fresh baked bread! The service is excellent and the staff is super friendly.   The pizza is California style(not deep dish, not thin more regular crust) but what makes this place great is the quality and value for the price!!! I mean they really pile on the ingredients!!! If you order any veggies on your pizza, they come out cooked yet crunchy because they are fresh!   They have great lunch specials for those who want a few slices of pizza and a soda but trust me, order a whole pizza and take it home; it's worth every penny!

6a7zcrmc4_as-1aHmxeKoA.text: I think it's amazing that you can get a vegan calzone, pizza, or sandwich here! The vegan sausage was so convincing I was almost nervous that they accidentally used real sausage!   I'd recommend straying away from the wheat crust. It's got that subway bread smell. For $10 the calzone was larger than my face! I'll certainly be back to try it with the regular crust. The marinara itself was delicious and you can add a copious amount of vegetables without the extra cost.   Do: cheat on your diet and get regular crust Don't: be "healthy" and get the wheat option  One thing to note is that this is your average pizza place. It's nothing fancy but sometimes you need a good old fashioned slice of pizza. I used their check in offer on yelp to get a free slice.

9ownThZeROiKEQWp-ZmN8A.text: I really had high hopes. Pizza used to be great years ago. Love that they have organic ingredients. Maybe it was an off night, but the pizza was really soggy and had so much cheese on it that it was almost inedible. Never thought I would ever complain about cheese, but WOW! Pretty bummed.

Qo87UJ2AOND275VJPSbqTg.text: Now open under new management. Excellent food and FAST. Pizzas, wings, fresh salads, sandwiches, beverages, pizza slices.  NOW OPEN

H1qZkCPxkUuGAyVFDnyftg.text: First time we tried this pizza and it was super yummy! The cook was a very friendly guy who told us all about the ingredients. We will definitely go back!

caZjCa_xwMutAwFlQIXHAQ.text: First off they were dog friendly, which is a big plus for us.  we had a groupon for four but only 2 of us showed up, and they treated us like 4.  the food was really good.  both salads rocked (ceasear and pear gorgon zola.   the pizza was tasty, and they had a surplus of vegetarian options.  finally there beer selecting was not massive but good.  no cheap domestic swill, all decent to good microbrewies.   The service was above average for a causal dinning experience. btw the way the groupon is an excellent deal!

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Can I have more pizza, beer and wings please.
Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The carnivore

ABDKzwVh5e2iLfYBjmPMpA.text: Back for a second time since their reopening.  Called ahead and ordered a pizza to go. It was ready on time, hot and fresh. Same delicious quality as before. Service was also friendly and accommodating.  Will definitely be back soon!

b3-wAjVgeAcqZnX4fUo0OA.text: I've never wrote a review for anywhere but I just have to for this pizza place it's the most amazing pizza I've eaten in years Arizona's best

7JKw-YRgrs4imzC-JBxwGQ.text: Ordered the casa blanca and mexican pizza  for lunch in the office. Even on a Sunday, the food was fresh,delivered fast and SOOOO filling... literally I had one piece and was full!

bAMcTUoh_85NJiol4ZvRFQ.text: Ask if they have the apple pie pizza. It is decadent.  We usually get home delivery from zpizza.  Yesterday we got a vegetable calzone, salad and wings. Everything was as expected and temperature perfect.  Try the BBQ wings - they are sweet, crispy and not overly sauced.

1Ts54JLIrnoe1KabxGK3AQ.text: I'd eaten here for years. Since becoming gluten-free in late 2011- I didn't think I'd enjoy pizza again. When family was visiting before Christmas we dined in and ordered four different pies. I ordered the gluten-free Provence (capers! artichoke hearts! basil!) Everyone enjoyed their pizza, and we ended up ordering a second-gluten free Provence since everyone enjoyed a slice of mine. A couple folks in my party had wine, others had beer. After we ate, we took the kids next door to Pink Spot where everyone enjoyed ice cream and sorbet.

AFYILHsII7B76Un2BmAsVQ.text: Zeeelicious!   There's nothing better than good pizza and Z sure does deliver!  Thin crust.  The type of thin that's still chewy.  None of that cracker-like, might-be-a cheese crisp kind of crust.  They've mastered the ideal pie base!  Appropriate amount of cheese.  Organic ingredients. Gluten-free options.  But the 'ZBQ' was the choice for me: BBQ sauce, chicken w/ roasted red peppers, red onion, tomatoes, cilantro and sweet corn! Definitely a taste bud tantalizer, plus this joint threw in a generous handful of red pepper flakes and parmesan sans my request!  That right there is worth a little extra doe, via tip.  Also, they've got quite a few original topping combos too: curry chicken & yam w/ mango chutney.  That'll be my next pizza splurge!

QjhdiMVTHXsYuDTzzyPdQQ.text: It was around 6pm on my third day in Phoenix when I was (finally) able to hang out and catch up with two dearly-missed SBC alums, Lynn W and Claire! Originally, we'd set out for the dessert place next door, but I had just returned from a 10-hour day trip out to Grand Canyon and back so a slice of pizza sounded perfect... The joint looks very collegiate and indie, full of simple designs, bright colors, and decisive lack of branding, although further inspection reveals it to be a widespread, though not yet prominent franchise. For just shy of $20, I ordered three slices and drinks for our impromptu dinner, myself gravitating towards the simple pesto slice, as usual. For the price per slice, it seems a tad on the expensive side, but the slice, its flavor and ingredients, is decent. The better option or deal is probably to get one of the heartier sounding whole pizzas [online menu: weborder3.microworks.com... Nonetheless, it hit the spot and service was very friendly. There's a cool symbiosis of Z Pizza being immediately attached and sharing a space with Pink Spot next door. ___________________________________________ Savory and sweet in a single space! Gluttony abounds!

fdOwx7tLdouIE5FuJ_FKRw.text: Pizza is so-so, good hang out place just next door. Weird service.  Went there today, had pear and walnut salad, that was good! The Lime Chicken sandwich was ok.

P_ahpswPc4I2wnbEV3CViA.text: Z Pizza is definitely in the a-ok realm for me.  I like that they have wheat crust available and that is centrally located.  Other than that, I think the prices are a bit high and the ordering system/counter area always seems awkward.    Because of the awesome amounts of gourmet pizza available around town, Z Pizza seems to be one of the only places that you can get a quick pizza to go and not have to end up with a Hot and Ready.  Just an a-ok, middle of the road pizza place.

-k0m7J-VK6ApXG_zTrFBNA.text: Short and sweet if you are looking for a GREAT to go pizza with organic ingredients and amazing quality these are your guys. Z pizza made me forget about movie night and Im just calling it pizza night now :)

jr0uVTQBi0QxSDKcWWMsGw.text: The good things about Z Pizza: It's open late, it's close to downtown, and they have vegan options.  The bad: It's a chain, they have like 6 parking spots, and the crust sticks to your teeth.  Seriously.  Also, I don't know if it's the type of vegan cheese or the way they prepare it, but it's just not that good.  It looks and tastes fake.  Pizza Heaven does it better.  This place gets the job done...but BARELY.

fOiBz4OCHYXtBV3s15EqEw.text: Good service, casual atmosphere, pizza was pretty good.

flMKvL0xki4odO_ike_cCg.text: Delivery is slow.  The delivery people NEVER offer or LEAVE pepper flakes or cheese.  In the case of wings they deprive you of any blue cheese or ranch sauce.  They are consistent in these omissions.  Must be a cost saving strategy....sucks

C4tF9U_HyyVDOGU7g2vldg.text: Pizza is decent...not spectacular. We ordered a large and two sodas and the total came to $25. I wouldn't go out of my way to return.

fsEGLNOTFNUlOARzHZr12Q.text: Midday parking at this place is seriously a joke, but such is the case with a lot of swank midtown lunch spots.   Pizza was great, my East Coast hailing girlfriend gave it a thumbs up, which for an AZ pizza place is a huge kudos. We came to check out both this and the adjoining Pink Spot Coffee and Ice cream. We ate on the ice cream side, so I can't comment much on the decor of the Z Pizza side.   Good ingredients, not the usual suspects, so that is a change. I will pay for good quality pizza, so the price was in line for the quality of the food.  It did a ton of lunch business but was efficient and the staff was smiling and not hating their life, which is always pleasant .

_y9fZ77jYBLOLPc2vm4_tw.text: Z Pizza is one of the best places I have discovered. Mainly because I don't like tomatoes, and Z is not totally about tomatoes either. There are so many items on their menu I have not been disappointed with, from Pesto pizza to cheesy bread to salad!! All of them tomato free.  The best feature though I have to say is their insanely easy to use online ordering. Being in the user experience industry, I'm frustrated with online ordering 95% of the time. Z makes me happy though. I actually sometimes miss them if I don't order occasionally. You can customize any item with almost anything you can think of and it's very easy to walk through. They also let you know up front if you are too far away for their delivery services so you don't sign up anyway.  I love you. I love you. I love you. And your use of fun ingredients like bacon and pine nuts and mushrooms :)

L9QsDoAylHNSlRSzuhFQYA.text: I won't lie, I was skeptical ordering from this place.  After a long day of painting my new apartment I needed some grub, and looking for a place that delivers to my new digs downtown I came upon Z Pizza.    I have to admit, I was not pleased by the hour+ in between order and delivery.  When the guy finally arrived, he asked me if I traditionally had a problem with delivery people not being able to find my place.  God I hope not!  I can't imagine it's that tough!  He went on to tell me that he had just made a delivery to my building earlier in the day and couldn't find the right building.  Well it says the building name in big letters on the side. . .Figure it out, especially if you get lots of orders!  On to the pizza.  At $13 for a medium cheese and $17 for a medium "Napoli", this is definitely on the pricier side.  And is it me, or is the "Italian Pizza" just a bit redundant?  I was under the impression that pizza itself was Italian.  Anyway, the pizzas were actually really good.  i liked the fresh basil on the cheese pizza, and the roasted garlic sauce on the Napoli was fantastic.  I'm sure I'll be trying their other pizzas in due time.

y_QXSHnTGpmtVzTHl2Ch0Q.text: Cool pizza, cool place.   The best thing about this place? It's open on weekends and it's open for dinner, so for that reason it has a special place in my heart.  That being said, the pizza's not very good. The sanwiches and pastas are pretty good, but then again, myabe I'm trying to find something nice to say about this place because, did I mention? It's open late and on weekends!

6zYkRy2qpqh6KlAMrvcs5Q.text: Z pizza SUCKS hands down! Management, owner's, employees and food can alllll go to hell ..save your $ and the stress form this unprofessional nasty ass'd business ....buyer be ware.

GRJk2vUoiUtplSQ7p_zbwA.text: I cant attest for the pizza but the salads here are pretty decent. I had the ZBQ Salad which was super fresh and tasty! The Mr had one of there new rustic pizza's which he said was pretty good. I swear, he needs to start Yelping as well! Anyhoo.. very good for a quick lunch.. PLUS, they totally carry Sweat Leaf Tea.. good stuff!!

pQ-xme5m4p4f8k4x6VD5Cw.text: My favorite is the Thai pizza sans chicken.  Wow.  Yum!  Anyone that puts bean sprouts on their pizza and can pull it off with flair and taste has to be given kudos!  Great veggie pizza by the slice...there's always one meat, one veg, and cheese...perfect!  Cozy spot to have a beer and grab a slice.  Plus, they usually have a special for two slices and a beer...so even better!

gedKOuOQBo4K8BS2C5GIPQ.text: I'm not going to even compare Z Pizza to NY pizza because they are completely different. For lunch Z Pizza is a decent choice...the times I have been there service is quick and there is plenty of seating to be had. The parking lot is really small and fills up quickly, but don't let that deter you.  The first time I went for lunch I had the pasta with grilled chicken, pinenuts, and basil pesto. For the most part it was a good dish even though the pasta was a tad overcooked. It wasn't an overly large portion, but was the perfect amount for lunch.  I believe the pasta and a drink was close to $10.  I have also had the Moroccan pizza (pesto, feta cheese, pinenuts, and eggplant) which was very tasty although it could have used a bit more feta. For a slice of the Moroccan, a garden salad, and a drink, it was $8.  Some of my coworkers who I dine with also enjoy the calzone (you will have to wait about 10 minutes for it though) and the Santa Fe pizza.  I'm not really a fan of gourmet pizza, but for a lunch spot downtown it is not bad. It's not my first choice but not a place I drag my heels to go to either. The one good thing about this Z Pizza location is that they will deliver at night to the State Capitol which we had them do once this fall when we were working late.

YV_StF4iOAMY1qZQrQLxug.text: All organic fresh whole wheat pizza. Kinda on the pricey side for a vegan pizza but pretty delicious !

ngiAR0Ime5L2xADaKNzugQ.text: The pizza is very delicious and the ingredients are fresh. The gluten free crust is good.

q_vICw6sY2JqndxmA3sgNQ.text: Got the Garlic Chicken Pizza...... just okay, nothing special. Fired Pie Pizza at nearby Park Central Mall is by far better.

FAT5gcthduBZTW6wbrnMsg.text: Love the gluten free aspect. Pepperoni or Veggie is my go too. By the slice, when available... Seems like someone new is always at the register and is slow as molasses. What's up with that Z Pizza? Get on the mailing list. Good stuff!

XYoWBfbLHkNujDv_TWhVew.text: Z pizza is my favorite cheese pizza ever  and I have lived all over.  I have always had good service, good delivery from this store. In the past the salads I had were relatively sparse on the toppings, but the ZBQ salad I ordered tonight was great. In the past I have had a few pizzas that were overcooked and a little charred on the crust, but overall I really like this place.  They also support local artists.  I will forever order pizza from them!

pr9GarRdV9JW-w5nijSMxQ.text: What more could you want in a casual pizza place?!  A variety of pizza's on the menu, other items as well.  A distinctive feeling and style.  A happy crew serving you deliciousness.  When I'm hanging around this area again, I'll be back!

z6SZyXpTfMtcl6PvlJbOHw.text: My family and I were visiting the area after flying to Phoenix for surgery at BNI. We just happened to see this place on the way to our hotel and decided to hop on over for lunch.  The pizza was top notch, in my opinion. It's obvious they use quality ingredients, and their salads look good too.  The only complaint I have is that the price was a little steep. It was $50-something for one XL pepp pizza, one L pepp + sausage pizza, 3 bottles of water, and one beer. We all felt that was a bit much, but it was very good pizza.   I also liked that the next door ice cream place was connected to the restaurant by a breezeway. It made it feel more like a community place. I recommend the place for pizza.

Yr4DVKdj1O1V43kGWrKX4g.text: Never again.  I used to be a big fan of Z Pizza but stopped going for about a year.  Decided to order a pizza last night and we were told it would take an hour, but it actually took closer to two hours.  When it arrived, the pizza was lukewarm and tasted very bland with stale/dry/hard crust.  The breadsticks were also hard and stale.  I had to douse everything in hot sauce and ranch dressing to make it edible.   The man who answered the phone was annoyed that we called to complain about our pizza being nearly an hour late, but offered to give us 30% off our next order.  Will not be taking him up on the offer.

jbMsnX-1sISEu5yD_ShNWg.text: I like this place and the layout of this establishment is cute and clean. As far as the pizza goes, I've never been dissapointed. I like their pizzas better than Domino's. They are next to the Pink Spot and they have free WI-FI.  It's a great place where it feels like you know everyone even though you're just there.  They also deliver in downtown phoenix, so it's great for me..  Bottom Line:  Comfortable. Comfort food, comfortable people, and a comfortable layout. Everything I need is right there.

E9Ry_sK5eiFQ43v6tGk4kg.text: This place isn't as bad as everyone says it is. I've never had a problem ordering from here. It's not the best pizza hence why I don't give it a 5 star rating but it's better than order Dominos and Papa Johns. It gets the job done when I'm craving pizza but don't want to go to a sit down restaurant. We usually order pepperoni pizza and the buffalo wings and pick it up.

lTk0fxw-nRnkUKtWyKUHEQ.text: Mediocre at best. The pizza is bland and soggy. The wings are 99% fat 1% Franks Red Hot sauce( maybe franks buffalo) the bread sticks are actually pretty good. The delivery time can't be beat. Pinos pizza is significantly better.

LVfQl7ZEwY7ySnyzuZPr1A.text: I never thought I could find pizza like this in Arizona!! The Mexican pizza is so good!! They have great beer on tap!

EdSNSoNbZAg6DwQBfbLPvg.text: It's pretty tasty stuff! They offer some interesting pizzas and the ingredients are usually pretty fresh. Sometimes if you go in at kind of a slow hour and get a slice, it'll be a little on the 'meh' side. The calzones are pretty good, they'll fill the craving if you have one.  Honestly what I am a big fan of at zPizza is their sandwiches and salads. They're flavorful, fresh, and the bread is awesome. The salads have interesting combinations and are a nice size.   Hit Pink Spot next door afterward for maximum gluttony.

RLFhkO1wA-ky6o3pPVxIYQ.text: I always end up having them deliver so I haven't been inside but the pizza is great! The Thai is my favorite. I love being able to get pizza that isn't horrible for you!

b0c6liyus7wiL-DGCLvdqQ.text: Ordered a calzone and salad for delivery at 11:09am and it is now 12:26pm and I still have not received. When I called to inquire they said they still had 3 more deliveries and that they can give me a discount on my NEXT order. At this point this order should be FREE!!!!

Y_nWDiQu_4S1rLfC02EOqA.text: Awesome pizza and salads. The arugula salad is awesome and we have tried their specialty pizzas too and have never been disappointed. They deliver to our office and have always been on time and our order has always been correct. Good job!

1bRJdtq0S2Zxz5zSfnJTxw.text: I'm all-in with any place that touts organic ingredients, so I wanted to give this place a whirl. After two visits, I'm just inclined to say "It's all right, I guess."  The pizza is more impressive than typical chain pizzas, of course, but both pizzas I tried (first being some Greek pizza and the second a masterpiece of my chosen ingredients) were pretty salty and greasy. I'm a fan of thicker-crust pizzas, Chicago-style and the like, so I wasn't super pleased with these more thin-skinned slices; but if you like that kinda thing..  Customer service here could also use work; it's not absolutely horrible, but both times I went the service lady (two different ones) gave the impression that I was holding her up or something. The second one, who I told we were going to be a second in deciding on our pizzas, said "okay" and stood and stared at us as we uncomfortably perused the menu. Better than disappearing, I guess, but still kind of jarring. The whole staff seems kind of "irreverent hipstery," and I can't stress that vibe of "We have something better to do" more.  The ingredients seem pretty good, though, and there are plenty to choose from for you out there who enjoy a slew of exotic flavors on your pie. I'd recommend it over most pizza places, just say to order carry-out online so you don't have to deal much with customer service and to shy away from any oil-based sauce (pesto/olive oil whatever) so you won't have an oil rag for a slice of pizza.

_6PPGqvetDfnJhDjnMj--A.text: First time ordering from here. Delivery took an hour and a half.   The pizza was yummy.   Very disappointed in the Antipasto Salad. It was supposed to have heirloom tomatoes, came with regular. Did not have any onions either.

DW_UIuQ9EEq6e4MLdcyQaQ.text: Great food! Delicious fresh pizza. Service a little slow. I knocked off a star because they don't recycle. That was a big surprise for a restaurant with organic food.

QQICS3KjeDFhnJqCJKfLpA.text: Yummy!  Their Napoli pizza is a vegetarian dream!  I've stopped in and eaten at this location several times and it is always clean and the pizza is hot.  My work has ordered pizza from here for dinner and it arrived hot and tasty.    They have so many different options.  If you're bored with your regular pizza joint, give Z a try.

J3K9YG3ijaCgCKTG1du3lg.text: If I could give it negative stars I would. First, the girl that answered had to be around my age. So early 20's. She was rude and didn't seem to pay attention or care. I was told 45minutes to an hour for delivery. An hour and a half later I call to politely ask where my order is and I was met again with attitude and disinterest. My order shows up as I am on the phone. The man on the phone asks if I can give my phone to the driver. The driver was rude as well but was instructed to give me half off my $25 single pizza. I appreciated the attempt and felt bad at sending him away as he was already here. I paid (as well as tipped the driver) and he rolled his eyes and walked away. I open the box to find not only was my half onion have olive pizza incorrect but it was cold, hard, and tasteless. I've worked in customer service for years and have never treated a customer the way I've been treated despite my polite attitude. Super disappointed. Will never be a customer again.

kj87MHAdbHo-5oBnX4NhIg.text: The pizza is excellent. I had one issue with a mis-marked pizza out of their display case recentlyof "by the slice": it was chicken barbecue which I cannot eat (I HATE chicken barbecue pizza) but the sign said "Neapolitan" too late as I had already taken it home.   I went in (May 20th) for a birthday lunch, and was disappointed in the experience. Me and my sister were enjoying our pizzas and one of the staff, seated a full two tables away watching television in the dining area- for some reason was listening in to our conversation! then joined in of his own accord. We politely replied with small talk and went on speaking more quietly to ourselves, which he then later again opined on of our comments which were not of his concern. It was very awkward being forced to entertain a person that I hadn't planned on speaking with. I am sure he thought he was being "friendly" but most paying customers do not appreciate the staff interrupting the customer and joining in their conversations.   The cashier also refused to enter in my phone number which gives the customer a free large pizza when they've spent a certain amount there. I wonder if he input someone elses number?   All of the staff seem to have tattoos all over the place- their arms, legs, what have you. Tattoos aren't cool anymore but I guess they are permanently stuck wearing them.

MAcYhWBPQswhTY49nj0B-w.text: My fiancee and I stopped by for lunch in-between classes to grab a slice of pizza. We'd been to Z Pizza once before and it was pretty good.  Apparently they had just opened because they had no slices out, and they told us it would be 10 minutes before it was ready. Technically they opened early, a little less than 10 minutes, so I think they were on time with preparation for the most part. The manager made sure to let us know they always try to open early for our benefit.   We browsed the local art (all 'abstract') on the walls, looked at the shop connected which had ice cream, interesting treats, and breakfast/lunch foods, but we ended up waiting for the pizza because we wanted something real and tasty (and less than $4-5 for one item).   One slice of pizza came out to about $3, which I expected since they are smaller and more specialty. The thing that made me happy was that it was a decently sized slice for both of us to share. It was the American, which was awesome. Fresh ingredients, bright colors, REAL thin crust (nice and crispy, yummy even plain), and not as much of a greasy feeling that is usually found in other pizzas that are loaded with too much cheese or whatever.   There was a little bit of a water/grease mixture that dripped off in the first handling, but that is just because of the fresh veggies and meat and cheese. If your meat and cheese doesn't have a drop of grease when cooked, something isn't right. This was in no way soggy or dense with grease. It was really a perfect slice of pizza to be honest.  The only thing that made me worried was a common nat or two flying around. With ingredients that are mixed and prepped on the open-aired counter-tops, that is a worry for me. It's not something very controllable by the employees or store hygiene, so I don't lose customer satisfaction, but I wonder if they ever get baked into the mix every 10,000th pizza. The irony is that there was one in the menu viewing box at the entry. I will stress that the place practices cleanly standards from what I observed.  All in all I know I am a satisfied customer when I don't regret spending my money and time and energy into going somewhere, which happens often. Z Pizza has a nice local, casual feel, not as concerned about a fake approach to you when you are there, and hey, they even warned us that the slice was really hot. It's about the quality of the food/time without being ripped off, and the food quality was really awesome! My fiancee and I would probably come here again for a close-by solution for hunger when we are waiting for our next class.  *If you want a more cafe atmosphere, the location on Central is good for that. They have live music near the outdoor seating weekly as far as I know, usually kind of jazzy.  P.S. Thumbs up for having same-priced gluten free options for pizza!

YOs5VAjj2Uf0ZCwQxO4Plg.text: From the moment I walked into the restaurant to the moment i left, I felt the food and the service lacked passion. The gentleman taking the order was very monotone and it seemed like the staff just got out of a meeting where everyone got in trouble. I ordered the meatball sub and a pepperoni pizza. The food came out within 10 minutes which was great but when i took a bite of the meatball sub and the pizza, It was bland. It needed salt and pepper. I will not be returning to this place.

tH7w2yPBrlDENQ7Wl6_LTA.text: I really want to give ZPizza 4 stars, but it's just not a 4-star pizzeria. Their veggie pizza is the best out of any 'delivery' I've had but doesn't rival Cibo or even Sauce.    The upside: Good veggie/vegan options. - You can opt for the whole wheat crust for no extra charge (the gluten-free crust is a $3-4 upcharge).  -Their California Veggie and Moroccan eggplant pesto pizza are divine.  -There's an ice cream parlor next door. - Their iced tea isn't awful.  The downside:  THE SERVICE. - We always order and pick up -- and are consistently on hold for more than 5 minutes, often times having to call back because they hung up.  - There are a few people working at this location who clearly hate their jobs. Their attitude and manner is really unpleasant to be around. I get it, you work at a pizza place and you're not that happy... but WHY take it out on the customers?   I came in the other night and watched a guy stand in line in front of me for about 8 minutes (he was already there when I arrived), while the girl at the front was on the phone. There's another register.. yet no one came up to help him. He ordered slices and by the time I told them what I was picking up, added a slice and got my drinks, he was STILL waiting. This poor guy waited 20 minutes just to get 2 slices of pizza that was already premade and in the case! That's just careless service.

HhW_AP8aYidDs7vNyZN3hw.text: The pizza is good. The customer is what is lacking. Hey if you want to order a pizza online and pick it up, make sure you check periodically to see if it is ready. I waited 36 minutes for my pizza which was in the warming oven. He response I got was ,"oh I guess it got lost". Thanks for wasting my lunchtime Zpizza.

EZ9pgW1Noq0ZIy8-i31cGA.text: The food is much like all other zpizza locations- always good, always fresh and always pretty standard size/taste/portion-wise, etc.   I usually always get the same thing at zpizza, but usually go to the Downtown Phoenix location near CityScape. To my knowledge, I ordered the same thing as usual and with my order and another usual entree, it seemed to be $5-10 more than the CityScape location....which is weird.  The staff is really unprofessional, had awkward "night out" stories that they were loudly telling in front of customers. I had to walk up to the counter and wait to get a box, as I was being seemingly ignored, but one of the employees was eager to help me once he noticed me.  It is conveniently placed near/connected to a dessert/cafe that looks cute, too, but I did not try it.   This place might be better for take-out or delivery, but I'm not sure. It just wasn't as good of an experience as other zpizzas that I have been to.

7wbqvjzexAb4kCfTJ-9esQ.text: I've been waiting 2 hours and 15 minutes for a delivery. I keep getting a different story about why it's so late. The truth is that I just don't care why. My family is hungry!

rkF0dxgPo6ARGQV0ZyBcxA.text: Just ordered from here. We got the wings and Mediterranean Platter. Took about an hour which was expected but we noticed we didn't get the hummus. When I called they said the driver tried calling to tell us they were out of hummus. He didn't call. He didn't tell me when he handed me the food at the door.

1tO_DQA4K-gX0tGufUoJZg.text: Yet another place I only choose when at work, having either forgotten or been too lazy or rushed to bring in my own dinner, and want something delivered instead of going out.  Happily, I don't special order anything - and my last couple orders have been the pear and gorgonzola rustica pizza. It's tasty. It's fresh, and it's filling. I think it's overpriced for what it is, but we don't have that many decent delivery options, so I'll deal with it.  I attempted the hummus once. Small portion, way too runny and completely lacking in flavor.  The special orders seem to be an issue. A coworker ordered the turkey sandwich and asked them to hold the tomato. That apparently was translated to hold the cranberry sauce, too. Pity - she really likes the cran. In fact - anytime any of us have asked for any "special" handling of our meals, there has been an error.  So - I'll stick with my pear and gorgonzola when the decision to order Z Pizza is made - and hope it continues to be A-OK.

KEYDpSaBZ0FU3b7Tv5n3TQ.text: Pizza here is pretty good, especially the vegan options.  But that's only if they have them, which they rarely do.  What is the point of having it listed on the menu when I constantly get calls after ordering to see if I still want the order because they can't completely fulfill it!?  Today, I CALLED first to ask and was told they "should" have it.  But they called me after I placed the order and let me know they didn't have it.  This location is such a joke.  The workers are obviously unhelpful when you call in and zpizza has never responded to my emails letting them know this location never has the vegan meat.  I will NEVER recommend this location to anyone.

d9BPKRJIGCieNNHjQCYvTA.text: Great pizza and great atmosphere! Don't take my word for it? Stop by and find out! You won't regret it.

V2BtjjHpRtgHTZ0tmprqGQ.text: I love window shopping. I love window fooding. Yes, I will spend my meals not people watching, but food watching.   What's great about Z Pizza is that you can order by the slice AND choose from their ready made pizzas on display. But be warned, everything looks good!

photos.caption: Photo of zpizza - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AGw9ETw-E4nnYPRGxFipPA.text: Z Pizza is pretty alright. What I appreciate most is that they have vegan and gluten free options.

XHmPw9KhIqwIjy6w3PekbQ.text: Just went in to grab a small pizza after a 12 hour work day. Ordered a Casablanca WITHOUT mushrooms. Girl behind the counter even repeated it to me.....when I picked it up they repeated again NO MUSHROOMS and even opened the box to look at it...get home, SURPRISE!!!! MUSHROOMS. Baked all into this pizza. Thanks for the fungus. Make sure you check your pizza before you leave.....

jeZXaSp1vqe2yoSUKY_2Gw.text: First, let me say, when it comes to Pizza, Z is probably the best in Phoenix.  Second, their service is terrible.  We have been going there for quite some time and they have gotten worse and worse. If you put in a n online order good luck on getting what you requested. They are all baked and can't read an online order to save their lives.   When you call to complain there are never any managers there so they don't give a shit.  Great pizza, terrible service.

7wHQEQGT-eRjpp-Fem5vyg.text: Whenever I order pizza, it's almost always from Z Pizza. Everything is fresh and delicious and the wait is never long.   I really enjoy eating there as well because of all of the options they have available. From vegan pizza to sub sandwiches, whatever you may be in the mood for, they've got it.   I'm actually on a personal mission to find the best pizza place in town and so far, Z Pizza is at the top of my list.

bNuFYJAZe4iro1gvZjY8ww.text: I tried a pepperoni pizza with extra cheese from zpizza on Sunday. It was just ok. Pretty dry as there was not much sauce under the cheese and extra cheese didn't quite reach the real extra cheese level to me. If my pizza was extra cheese, I'd hate to see what a regular amount of cheese would be. My last bite seemed to have all the sauce I wished would have been in each bite. At $18.95 (including tax) for a one item with extra cheese thin crust 14"  pizza, definitely not worth the price despite all the organic claims on the box. However, as organic goes, this wasn't bad by any means. Service was good, they quoted me 15-20 minutes and the pizza was hot and ready when I arrived. The price alone will prevent me from coming back.

uUTUx_wEqvv3dl6ieE0h9g.text: Over a week for horrible customer service... Customer since 2007, not anymore I basically wrote them off after talking my dad and family into ordering from them one night instead of Papa John's. Fresh ingredients and real food right? But after they delivered it, the pizza I ordered for dad was soggy and undercooked. (which is alway the worst when you build a place up, finally get others to try it, and get burned!) 2 weeks ago for Father's Day, I was spending time with my dad and asked him what he wanted to do for dinner, he asked for Z's. I tried to persuade elsewhere, but he just wanted to relax at home. So I called up and placed an order, then ran to pick it up. When I left with it, they forgot to put the 2 slices of pizza in the bag (I looked in it and thought everything was there) Get home, realize they are missing so give them a call. me-"Hey this is Steve, I was just there, you guys forgot my 2 slices of pizza" "ya, they are sitting right here" ..... ..... me- "okkkkkk, well what do you guys do in situations like this...." "they are sitting right here" ............. me- " Ok....well we just sat down to eat, and I'm not running back up there right now, so in situations like this, what do you guys do to make this right, have the delivery driver drop them off or just refund me for them?" "I will add a 5 dollar credit to your account that you can use next time" me- "uhhh I think the 2 pieces cost more than 5 bucks, so can you just refund my card back the right amount" At this point I was already DONE with this place, who forgets food then doesn't offer to make it right, THEN lowballs you on a credit?? If you are going to offer me a different amount, At LEAST offer me MORE than what I paid for not LESS! INSANE "ok I just did the refund" me- "thanks man" that's it, no apology, nothing. He also sounded like he wasn't on point, and after the way he handled it AND originally forgetting my food I was worried about the refund. I kept an eye on my credit card account, and 3 business days later, still no refund, so I called back up to find out whats going on. He never did it. Wednesday: after 20 mins on the phone, I am told that the owner will have to call me back to investigate this and issue a refund. Odd that NO ONE there can handle this or refund my money Friday: Still no refund and no call from the owner, so I call AGAIN and explain it all over for the 2nd time. I was told the owner would have to call me and let me know. later that day he does, is nice on the phone, says sorry, and that he can't refund me back on my credit card, that I will have to swing by to pick up the refund once he is done, I explain how disappointed I am and how I waited almost 1 week and had to call 3 times for a refund, after not getting my food, getting a lowball credit offer, and being told I would get a refund and NOT, and that I now have to drive back up there to collect my refund. He has nothing to add but "sorry" and he is "trying to make things better there because there has been some customer service problems" ------ Well earlier tonight I was riding by, so decided I would grab it (a tank of gas in my bike) so went in and asked for it open up the envelope, thinking mmmmmmaybe they will throw something in there, like a free pizza coupon to make it right, but nope 6 bucks and 1 penny If they had thrown a coupon in, I was already mentally ready to ask for the manager and give it back. I don't want their food, or anything FREE, and that it's the principle. and I thought it would be BOSS to do, give it back :D but would had scored points in my book for the effort but NOPE all of that, calling them 3 times, all just so I can drive back up there to get my money back so heads up this is how they treat customers who have gone there for years, who's orders get forgotten, and takes them almost a week just to give a refund as a business owner, and former manager in the food industry, that isn't how you take care of your customers such a shame, love supporting local businesses and had recommended them to quite a few people before so if you are thinking about hitting this one, I HIGHLY recommend you look east, 2 buildings over, Pino's- yelp.com/biz/pinos-pizza... , and try them out AMAZING customer service, friendly, helpful, and waaaaay better food seriously, you can see I gave them a 5 star almost 1 year ago, that's where I've been going for pizza since

g1znc5_pAoKBBKtxinHwfw.text: It's good but not extraordinary. Service is always great, food is always made fast. It's definitely better than your average pizza, but compared to some of the pizza out there, I've become desensitized to gourmet pizza.
